description:
I've seen zpizza around the world, literally.  Do you know there are 50+ locations, even in South Korea, UAE, Vietnam, and Kingdom of Bahrain?  So, no, it's not a little boutique, family-owned, pizza joint.

Delivered directly thru my Yelp app on Samsung and fulfilled by Grubhub, I am full of namedropping today.  The ordering was easy, and for $23 with 6 toppings, my small pizza was delivered to my hotel room in a jiffy (okay, 45 mins).

The delivery guy was casual, and just holding the cardboard box in-hand. I was expecting it to be pulled out of a pizza warming bag, so it's received hot and steamy.  Instead, it was lukewarm at best.

But cool pizza has its benefits.  You can literally eat a whole small pizza in about 6 minutes.  No blowing each bite.  No biting small.  No biting on the ends.  You can get into trouble quickly, and I'm not opposed to that.

I ordered a small pizza with Organic Tomato Sauce, Pepperoni, Avocado, Mozzarella, Ricotta, Mushrooms, Artichoke Hearts, and Caramelized Onions.  To be frank, it was quite good -- love the medium crust with quality ingredients. To be elizabeth (or insert any other name other than frank, otherwise this humor doesn't work), I was underwhelmed with the quantity of the ingredients, very sparingly done.  It's like I paid for more ingredients, but it's like the divided the ingredients to make that much less per.

There's lots more pizza places to try, but this is a good one...no matter your location, language, or country.
author: Randy B.

description:
Pretty decent little pizza joint by my house. I like the vibe in here, it's convenient. 

They use fresh ingredients, but the pizza is missing something I feel like. Plus I hate how hot it is after they reheat it. Meh. 

You'll have to take my review with a grain of salt because I was raised on the east coast and the pizza around here I just hate in general. 

However, I think easily if I was to think of pizza places, Tony's, Golden Boys, and Patzi all got this place beat in spades.
author: John W.

description:
I've been here a few times & the pizza is great. The service is friendly & the pizza made fresh to order. I think you can buy by slice too. Several bottled beers available. The girl working up front is friendly & keeps busy cleaning when no customers ordering.  She always has a smile on her face.  She also checks on customers to see if they're enjoying their pizza. I like that whenever I've been here it's not super busy.  The restroom is kept locked. Ask for the key if you need to use it; it doesn't say that on the door. 
They do a lot of takeout business here. 
So stop by here if you're hungry at meal time & want to go where there's not a long line. I don't like lines or places that have inadequate seating. Have not had a problem with either here.
author: P P.

description: Great pizza joint in the Financial District. I came here during Dreamforce so the wait was a little longer. It was a quite atmosphere for all the hustle and bustle of the city. It was nice to enjoy my beer and pizza while people watching at the window. The pizza was sooo delicious. I ordered a small pepperoni and mushroom and ate the entire thing.
author: Olivia M.

description: Meatball sub was delivered completely burnt.  Never again.  Not sure if this was a joke?
author: Jay T.

description:
No complaints!

I enjoyed every bite of this pizza. It was made in about 10 minutes and it was SO fresh. We ordered the zBQ pizza with bbq and chicken. The chicken was tender and it was topped with a lot of tomatoes/red bell peppers, cilantro, red onions, and a delicious bbq sauce. The place is clean and tidy.

The crust was SO delicious. Overall, we ate every bite. A small may be able to fill 1-2 people. If you're really hungry and it's 2 of you, get a medium. :D
author: Natalie M.

description: Tasty organic pizza for an amazing price! The staff is extremely friendly and the dining area itself is perfect for people watching or getting lost in a conversation. I'll definitely come back the next time I'm in the city.
author: D J.

description:
I've been here 2 times over the span of 3 years. 

The first time, I was in the area for a show, so my wife and I got a couple of personal pizzas and a salad to share. We enjoyed the food and had a good experience.

My second time here was on a Saturday afternoon, and I was appalled at how slow the service was. There were only two staffers at a peak lunch time. One person on the register/serving, and one person making the food. 

I was behind around 6 people in line, and it took about 15 min to get up to the front of the line. 

I just wanted a couple of quick slices, so the slow service and the restaurant being understaffed definitely left a sour taste in my mouth. Not sure I'd return if I looked inside and only saw two staff.
author: Amy R.

description:
Vegetarians/vegans: order the Berkeley Hippy pizza with jalapeños added. Add Trader Joe's  soy chorizo protein, capers, kalamata olives. Place leftover doggie box leftover pizza pie in your home broiler to heat with the newly added toppings! Spectacular. 

Give a a girl a hand clap? Maybe thumbs up this review if nothing else?
author: Athonia C.

description:
Place - Near Metreon and West Field. Next to the adult ship Vibration. There are enough tables inside. 

Taste - There are many kind of pizza and salade. Three size, small, LG, XLG. We were 4 men and 1 woman. One XLG, one LG pizza and one LG salade was enough for us. Chicken cesear salade was simple but great. Amount was pretty a lot and fresh vegie with tasty sauce. We ordered one Zc--- pizza(I forgot its name, in the meat category and the first one) and italian pizza. Z pizza is my favorite one, good conbination of ingredients. Italian pizza was many vegie and basil sauce base. It wad also good. 

It is also good for pre-order and take it at home. 

Service and Price - Service was soso and price is reasonable.
author: Da Won L.

description:
GREAT PIZZA for a night out!

For some reason, it is a bit difficult to find a great place for pizza around my area. After work, I decided to go to zpizza for a quick 2 slices of pizza before going to a concert and it was the best choice I've made!

Pizza Quality: 5/5 - Not knowing what to expect as this was my first time, the pizza slices were delicious and cooked just to the right crisp! I got the sausage/mushroom and pepperoni slices and I am so glad I did. 

Customer service: 6/5 (if that's allowed) - The first person I came in conversation with was at the cash register. He was super friendly, talkative, helpful with ordering, and quick. He made our experience amazing. Our pizzas were also delivered to us by him and the wait time was not out of the ordinary for pizza slices (about 5-10 minutes.) Later, he came back up to us and asked how we liked the pizza. I said it was great and also asked if he was the owner, and he was! Unfortunately, I did not get his name, but he made our experience great!

Delivery: Yes - zpizza themselves do not do delivery but they do utilize UberEats and GrubHub.  I will still use them for pizza to be delivered to my home!
author: Michael T.

description:
I did take out for dinner here. I honestly never heard of this place until my boyfriend recommended it! I definitely felt I was missing out because they have some really great pizzas here!

We ordered the Mexican Pizza, it had great toppings such as chicken, avocado, tomatoes, onions and some sour cream. I was pretty blown away and it tastes even better when you add sriracha to it! I would definitely order here again, I think it tops the other pizza chains!
author: Natalie L.

description: Great pizza and friendly service, both times going on our trips we have gone here! Pizza by the slice as well
author: Robert B.

description: Once I got passed all the crack heads screaming and homeless people, I ate a dry slice of pepperoni pizza. Hardly any sauce and cold. Stomach wasn't feeling too great after. I don't recommend it.
author: Jay B.

description:
Finally! I got a European pizza style after 4 mounts of eating papa jones and dominos. American style is great too, but it is pizza bread for me. 
You can choose many type of pizzas there and parmesan have to be on the table. Pizzas are delicious there. If you'll try it, you'll like it. Enjoy.
author: Martin K.

description: Can't go wrong with zpizza. I and their vegan pizza and it was to die for. Plus this particular restaurant was very clean and the staff was wonderful. Would totally visit again. Great place to take a break from shopping.
author: Molly C.

description:
I've been eating at zpizza since the mid 80s when there were just a few Orange. county CA locations run by "Zid and Zue". As a freshly transplanted New Yorker, I was hungering for a good old NYC slice, and Z delivered on that plus more. 

Fast forward 30 years and Sid has franchised the concept, with zpizza branches sprouting up nationwide. Fortunately, it is not bad! Compared to other pizza chains it's mostly like Sbarro, but with better fresher ingredients and thinner crust cooked well. 

I sampled both cheese and pepperoni, my favorites, and my main complaint was a bit too much cheese, making it hard to fold. You might find that a plus and not a minus. I like that they always have a few slice choices, and of course you can always get a personal pizza exactly to your liking. 

Check out the pepper infused olive oil, still part of the zpizza tradition after all these years. If you're around the 5th and Mission garage stop in for a slice and PLEASE let me know what you think. 

I kind of hope they get a marin location going.
author: Mike K.

description:
I ordered a gluten free pizza ,vegiterian, and must say that I really liked it . 
The place located in the mission street,very warmy .
author: Luiza N.

description:
ordered thru Amazon delivery. Timely, $5 tip and $5 delivery a bit much but automatically added. Pizza "Provence" and 'Zbq" fantastic flavors. The large pepperoni was charred on bottom (yukk), nasty. Called next day and Holly set us up with new pizza, excellent customer service.

Will order again, but DONT USE AMAZON.
author: Paul E.

description:
This is hands down the best vegan pizza I've had. The crust is super delicious! And the tomato sauce on it heavenly. 
I ordered vegan Berkeley and swapped the veggie burger crumbles (didn't want any processed patty crumbles) with jalapeños. It was amazing! I strongly recommend that if you like a bit of a spice. It goes extremely well with everything else on that heavenly crust! 
Can't wait to go back!
author: Yoshita S.

description: Ordered a delivery from Uber eats for a vegan mushroom pizza & margarita pizza on our first night in San Francisco and after a good 45min plus wait received a sausage pizza, no idea if the margarita was vegan. So disappointed, would not recommend ordering from them for any dietary needs.
author: Gemma B.

description: Stopped in quick for a slice of mushroom and sausage. Service was good and it was a solid above average slice of pizza. Worth checking out if your in this part of town.
author: Sean G.

description:
Delish. I happened upon this restaurant after a public event.  I had a glass of wine and gluten free pizza.  I enjoyed my experience and the food.  The staff was friendly and they suggested topping and combinations that I might enjoy.  

The restaurant is centrally located, just under the parking structure on Mission.  It's a very fast order and service.  

I would go back here and would recommend trying this restaurant.
author: Veda F.

description: I enjoy pizza. Who the $uck doesn't? So, when you become Vegan, you're assumed to be SOL when it comes to having a great experience with pizza in this city. No more Tony's, no more Golden Boys (not that that was really any good..) No more a lot of things...but zpizza reopens that door for Vegans again. I mean, sure, they use Daiya cheese when they should use Follow Your Heart cheese, but whatever, I'll take it. They have a Vegan sausage crumble and it's fire roasted pizza people! Yes! So here's what I do since I absolutely hate zucchini's and refuse to order their Berkley pizza. I get a custom large (large because I feel like they pack it with a better ratio of ingredients), vegan sausage, daiya cheese, cremini mushrooms, and a side of arugula. This will run you a little under $30 for delivery. When I get the pizza at home, I'll put slices of thin red onion, and avocado over it, and toast it back for a couple of minutes...oh, and also the pine nuts because that adds a little more "porky" flavor to the sausage. Pure Vegan Gold. Okay fellow Vegans, have fun. This place is 10x better tasting than Patxi's. Side note, I used to get Patxi's a lot, but they've seemed to screw up my order every time, so I'm SO HAPPY i've found zpizza in this city.
author: Brian C.

description: I tried this place on a whim and now I am hooked! They have this Berkeley vegan pizza that is AMAZING! This will now be my go to pizza place! It was sooo good!
author: Erica S.

description: Ordered UberEats and there was two pepperonis missing on my pizza.. no joke two pepperoni marks were on my pizza where pepperoni was clearly stolen by the driver or an employee. Please next time seal the food.. tape it up.. do something.. as this has happened on multiple occasions. Can't trust unknown, unverified, high as a kite drivers with the food. I worry about tampered pizza now and will never order again.
author: Holly M.

description:
zpizza is the second closest pizza-by-the-slice spot near my office. The other is Chico's Pizza, which I liked a lot more than this. zpizza did NOT heat up the slices I ordered to go, so they were cold...Maybe I was unlucky?

Anyways, it's pretty nice inside and has the typical pizza joint feel. For $7 something + tax, you can get 2 slices and a drink, which I think is a pretty good deal. Except that they don't heat up the pizza. When you go up to order at the register, there's a tall-ish glass display that holds all the pizzas you can order by slice. It doesn't look like it's heated in any way. After I ordered, I waited maybe 5-10 minutes, thinking it was because they were heating up my slices. Nope. Got the America and the special, which was chicken bacon and some type of cheese. The crust was doughy/chewy, and I suspect it would've been better if it had been heated up.

Expect an average slice of pizza... Costco pizza is better (and cheaper) =/
author: Doris K.

description:
We had pizza catered from zpizza and it was great! Two days before the party, we ordered 30 pizzas via their website and it was user friendly and quick. The delivery guy arrived on time and was friendly! He helped lay out all the pizzas by flavor, which made this pizza party a breeze. I tried a slice of the American (pepperoni, mozzarella sausage, mushroom, bell peppers, and red onions)  and ZBQ (bbq sauce, chicken, mozzarella, roasted red peppers, tomatoes, and red onions). Both were good and I would get it again. One of the better pizza spots in the area for sure. Would come back here to satisfy pizza cravings :) 

Note: don't forget to request plates, cheese, and pepper for catering orders!
author: Mandi H.

description:
Good pizza & great service enough said....
Ok, I had 2 slices of cheese pizza. The pizza was good, service great, no beer.
author: Larry N.

description:
Ordered a couple small pizzas, chicken bacon and a Greek. Also ordered a large pepperoni.

Great quality ingredients and awesome flavor.

Price is fair. Will order again
author: Harley M.

description: Awesome pizza we sampled 4 different ones and they were all awesome there spicy Hawaiian is top 3 Best pizza I have ever had!
author: Zack T.

description: I'm a pizza snob, and it is hard to find Great pizza in SF.  I'm not going to claim that zPizza has the best crust, sauce, or cheese. The reason I am giving this place a 4 star, and the reason you should try it, is they have a number of interesting pizza choices including a super spicy thai pizza and a french inspired Provence pizza. My mouth is always happy tasting their unique combinations.
author: Andrew B.

description: Wanted to eat at NY pizza but couldn't wait until 3pm when they opened. Wanted pizza, this was the closest and was hungry.  Very happy I stopped here, awesome pizza, my 3 Girls, wife and I were very satisfied!
author: Andrew P.

description: Best customer service ever for San Francisco!! Great pizza!  Ate in, but am going to order one to go back to Oakland:)
author: Melissa S.

description:
My friend and I were shopping in the financial district area and craved pizza so we just came to satisfy our cravings. Zpizza offers pizza by the slice (only 3 options--cheese, pepperoni, and mushroom) and also by the box (small, medium, large) with more options and toppings available. 

I mean the pizza here was good and we definitely satisfied our pizza cravings and I would come again but I wouldn't say that the pizza here was SUPER out of the ordinary or anything. To say the least, I think the pizza here is worth the price paid.
author: Christy W.

description: We ordered delivery food from zpizza and the vegan pizza was excellent. We ordered a thicker crust with some veggies on it and the crust, sauce, and veggies were pretty great. This will probably be my vegan delivery pizza place going forward. High five!
author: Christina M.

description:
I woke up one day with a HUGE craving for vegan pizza (weird right??) and was lucky enough to remember that zpizza had vegan offerings! 

I swung by on a Saturday afternoon and had the "Berkeley Pizza", I can't remember the exact name. But it was delicious! The pizza reminded me of a very tasty fresh tomato Bruschetta. It was both the right blend of juicy and also had the right amount of give for a pizza!

I'm not vegan but I will definitely be back to grab some more :)
author: Sean S.

description: Very scrumptious.  Far from being too salty, which is the most common pitfall for all other Bay Area pizzerias.  Highly recommended their combination pizza and pepperoni pizza.
author: June C.

description: On the wishlist: 1) pizza and 2) close to our hotel. My wife and I with our 11 year old son ate dinner on February 22, 2018. Boy, were we pleasantly surprised. The owner is from Chicago and makes an awesome pizza! The place is clean, good service and centrally located near Market and 5th Street. Pretty sure we are going back tonight!
author: Mike S.

description: Don't get to eat pizza often because I'm gf. Ordered the ZBQ Chicken gluten free with vegan cheese. One of the best gf pizzas I've had. Def recommend!
author: Cindy Y.

description:
Great place for gluten/dairy free dinning. 

Might be the best gluten free pizza I've ever had (and I live in NYC). The gluten free crust (which comes in the small and medium size) can be subbed in on any pie, and is baked special for ZPizza. It is a thing crust, but the crust part is crunchy, and the rest is soft and chewy. Absolutely perfect. 

We subbed the mozzarella for daiya mozz, and it was delicious. 

To be noted, I'm not gf/vegan, so I know what these things are "supposed to taste like". 

Highly recommend if you're in the area and looking for pizza.
author: D F.

description:
5 stars for a fast-casual spot that is simple and straightforward. This is the place to go if you just want a good slice of pizza. Some other highlights are:

- They serve beer.
- They offer pizzas by the slice or you can get an entire pizza in small, large, or extra large.
- Variety of custom pizzas. We had the Garlic Chicken which I highly recommend if you love garlic!
- Great service. And the pizzas come out fast!
- They also have salads, sandwiches, & garlic bread.
- The crust was perfect. Light and crunchy. I can't stand pizza places that have soggy crust because then all of the toppings slide off when you try to pick it up.
- There are tables and counter top seating so that you can sit & enjoy.
- Pricing is very reasonable.

Will definitely be back! This is a great pizza spot.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
During a recent visit to zpizza I ordered a small Bacon Bleu, slavering with anticipation at the thought of gobbling my favorite pie in the world. A few minutes later I was given a Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza, an apology for getting the order wrong, and a promise of the correct order on the way, free of charge. "This will reflect positively on your gratuity," I smiled at my server. He responded that the error was his and that no further gratuity was expected. 

The least I can do is write this review, give the place five stars, and say that the Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza is now my second favorite pie in the world. Thanks, zpizza!
author: Ken P.

description: Great gluten-free pizza! It's so good that even my mates who like gluten ("real pizza") are more than happy to share a gluten-free crust!
author: Vikram N.

description: Great service! The owner was awesome! The food is delicious! The owner actually made the calzone himself which showed love for his own business. He delivers the food to the table himself. We are definitely returning and recommending this pizza place.
author: Mcloven Y.

description: We had a quick bite of free pizza and it was excellent for the price and the service was quick and friendly. Not a great place for dinner or romance but who cares it is delicious.
author: Henrik L.

description: One of my fav gluten free pizza place :) Food came out fast and gluten free dough is yummy!
author: Kelly K.

description: Best gluten free pizza in SF! Their pizzas are amazing. I love that they offer GF crust without a huge extra charge. The BBQ bacon blue is delicious!!
author: Amanda F.

description: Got delivery. It took an hour and half. They messed up the order and it was room temperature.
author: Jacob R.

description: Cheese pizza with double olives. Pizza was fresh and very tasty. Not greasy or wet in the middle. Dinner salad was not bad either. Ranch salad dressing. This also looks like a great place to come for a slice. Clean dining room and clean bathroom. Friendly service. Great choice if you're on foot. If you park in the Mission Garage just long enough to eat it will not cost you a fortune.
author: scott h.

description: It was good I thought the pizza was delicious. No complaints but not a 5 because I wasn't blown away.
author: Monica S.

description: Really good food and excellent service!!! Would totally come back again for more. They have some good choices to choose from. Its great that they have organic options to choose from.
author: Brittany R.

description: The restaurant has a nice comfy and casual setting.  I went here with my coworker to try it after hearing positives about the place.  Grabbed a slice of the mushroom and sausage pizza which came out to be $3.80 (it's SF prices).  Grabbed a seat by the window to people watch and see the world go by as you're eating.  The pizza was nothing to write home about and it had a taste where you can taste that they haven't cleaned their oven or need to get a new one.  It had some sort of electronic or electrical taste, if that makes sense.  Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Chan L.

description:
Whenever I'm in the mood for pizza and don't want to settle for cardboard-tasting Dominoes, I head to zpizza!

They are not exclusively vegan, but they have enough options to make any vegan smile!

Daiya Cheese (everyone's favorite)
Vegan Burger Crumbles
Vegetables of all sorts, including shiitake & cremini mushrooms, zucchini, caramelized onions, sprouts, and serrano chilies.

They already have a great menu of pre-made variations, but of course you could always build your own.

I've done both, and yes I have tried the Berkeley Vegan. It is what I wanted (with both daiya cheese and vegan burger crumbles), but also has a great selection of vegetables on top including zucchini, mushrooms, bell peppers, and red onions.

A small has 6 slices and I find it perfect to share. Larger appetites should opt for a medium for 2 people. 

The prices are fair, the service is quick and friendly, and the taste is on point!
They also have a decent (albeit limited) bottled beer selection. Choose from Drake's or Anchor or Ballast Point. Goes perfect with a warm gooey slice!
author: Lanie L.

description: The pizza was delicious, along with the Parmesan flatbread!!! But the reason I really gave this place 5 stars was the service. It was quick, friendly and above all genuine. The woman that rung us up made sure our visit was more than satisfactory . Anytime I am in the area I will most definitely be going here!!
author: Angelica T.

description:
I gave this place 1 star. If I could give it a negative 1 (-1) I would. I went one week and I bought a slice of pizza and a cold drink.  I asked to use the restroom, and when I returned the key, the young male employee literally snatched it from my hand.  I was very offended and said so.  He made no attempt to excuse himself.  When I went back yesterday and bought a drink, I explained the incident to Holly (she was present when this took place), and she merely gave me a blank look and shrugged.  

I will never return to this restaurant again.  The customer service is horrible, and they make no effort at righting wrongs. Moreover, the pizza is absolutely mediocre.  It was cold and lacked flavor.  There are many pizzerias in the Mission and the Tenderloin.  I implore you to AVOID Z Pizza at any and all costs--go where they food is good and they treat their customers right.
author: Victor B.

description: Went here because it was close to our hotel. Didn't have real high expectations....after all, it's just a local pizza joint, right? Well, we were very surprised! The pizza was so good!!! I highly recommend it. Clean. Good service. Owner is from Chicago, so the pizza is worth the trip!
author: Ginny S.

description: This pizza is the bomb! Crust is perfection. Sauce is yummy. I would've took a picture but I was hangry and had to eat!  I would definitely recommend coming when downtown
author: Chari K.

description: Ordered a single slice mushroom/sausage pizza and was awesome! Freshly baked and toppings were all great tasting! For the price it definitely was worth every bite. The manager every time great guy & very accommodating every visit.
author: Paul E.

description: I've ordered the Berkeley pizza three times from this location and each time they have failed to include the veggie burger crumbles. Tonight I paid extra to have them put extra on in case they just overlook it each time- still nothing. I've ordered from Ubereats, which clearly shows this as an ingredient, although I've never seen any proof of this so I am actually not sure they even have this ingredient.
author: Morgen S.

description: Recently had their vegan pizza. It's really nice that they have an option for vegans, but the pizza itself was REALLY expensive and pretty boring compared to other vegan pizzas that I have had. Sadly, this pizza place seems like the best in SF for vegan pizza. The staff were really nice and the eating areas were all clean.
author: Hans T.

description: The prices are pretty affordable. They have a slice of pizza, a side salad, and a fountain drink for $7.95. Quality of the food is pretty mediocre, but I was hungry so it got the job done.
author: Sierra W.

description:
No complaints whatsoever. 

I work in the downtown area and I love pizza! They closed Blondie's recently (THANK GOD!!!) and there's literally no pizza by the slice place conveniently near by. And if there is, it's like $6 a slice! NO THANKS. I discovered this place via Yelp. 

Extremely grateful, it's not PERFECT, but it's just right. Excellent place to drop by on my lunch for a quick pepperoni slice, grab a window seat to unwind and people watch. Service was alright. Didn't get a smile nor was I asked how I was doing. (Isn't that standard?) anyway, I appreciate them bringing the pizza to my seat I guess.

The pizza was good. It wasn't too thin and there was a sturdy amount of crust. Slices are great size as well. 

Good job Zpizza!
author: Rayne J.

description: Decent cafeteria-style pizza place where you can get pizza by the slice. There aren't a lot of options for by-the-slice, at least at non-peak hours, but the pizza is pretty good-- hot, thin-crust... Plus a reasonable price for lunchtime.
author: Allison M.

description: Almost 4 bucks for a slice which is pretty common in SF. The slices are a decent size and fast service!
author: Priscilla S.

description: I loved eating this pie. Thin crust, fresh, hot, and delicious. It's seems like an easy formula but I get surprised all of the time. The kicker for the 5 stars was attitude and service. Didn't hurt to listen to the sweet music that was on. Kids thought it was great, price was right, clean, and a nice atmosphere. Well done!
author: Rick P.

description: Delicious pizza and very fast with a ton of options for meat eaters and vegans alike. Try the veggie burger crumbles!
author: john m.

description: I have never been a big fan of California style pizza (the kind of awkward in between of thin crust and thick crust) because the dough never turns out as good as one might expect. But this restaurant proved that it is possible to make good California pizza where the dough is still semi thick but has a very slight smoky taste to it and just the right amount of crunch that makes pizza taste so good. I got the Thai Chicken Pizza, which was made in California a f it was very good. I also really liked how you can order online and the pizza is ready within 20-30 minutes which is just enough time to walk there and sit down and eat. I highly recommend it and the price isn't something you wouldn't normally spend on lunch so you should definitely try it.
author: Itzak H.

description: whoa I was really impressed with the freshness and the wonderful crispy crunch of the crust. Walking in  there was a nostalgic smell of baking pizza and I thought  Jesus this is what  it's supposed to smell like. I brought my kids and we  ordered two pizzas, may I suggest the toscana mushroom  it was delicious!!!!! The soda fountain an amazing  plus, as well as nice service ! On the down side we waited way to long for our order but it's a small place with awesome music and yes I will be returning.
author: Melanie L.

description:
Updated:   Went Sunday (Folsom) 24 September.  I wanted to give this location a second opportunity to redeem themselves.  Mistakes happen.  I get that.  So I call before going there to ensure they have gluten free as well as are in stock of all items. 

Three of use out of a party of 6 arrived early. A "man" that claimed to be the owner asked me if I was Jack.  Note previous review from Friday. I said yes.  He advised me he would refuse to serve me and my party due to the one star I gave this location. He not only refused to allow me to speak but ORDERED me out of the restaurant along with my party.  
So, to summarize. If I could give ZERO stars I would. This person has NO business handling customers or dealing with the public in any way shape or form. He is a very angry person that truly needs help. I WILL be contacting ZPIZZA corporate offices to report his actions and comments.   But on a side note, a Vietnamese restaurant just maybe 75-100 ft away was terrific!  Green Papaya. The owner was understanding regarding food allergies as well as very knowledgeable about the entire menu. That is someone that should handle the public and certainly knows his stuff. He'll be getting the 5 stars. Not ZPizza
author: Jack G.

description: A good value for the XL cheese pizzas that I ordered for my office!  Definitely nowhere on par with Delfinas or Montesacro but I needed to feed 35 people for $150. So I give this place 4 stars.
author: Laurence S.

description:
Finally! One of the better pizza spots that actually deliver to my area! 

Ordered: Half Pepperoni, Half Sausage and Mushroom 
The dough was thin and crispy, a crunch to every bite of the crust. The pepperoni was cooked to perfection - a little bit crispy, yet still held its juices. The sausage and mushroom was evenly spread out on the pizza. All in all, delicious in each and every bite. 

Though the downfall to all thin crust pizzas is that it takes a lot more to fill you up. My fiancee and I ordered an XL pizza (18") thinking we'd have plenty for leftovers. The slices were cut pretty big; we each had two slices, and there were only 4 remaining. We're not big eaters, so keep that in mind when ordering! 

Yeah, it's a little pricey and they add $2 for delivery, but I can honestly say this is one of the best pizzas I've had in the neighborhood. Oh and the delivery guy was super nice too!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Good pizza!  I just ordered by the slice 2 pepperonis and a drink for $9 and I was really full.  
The slices looked a little basic but there was a little more flavor than i expected and good cheese.  Not greasy.

Friendly service!

I'm looking forward to trying something with more toppings from the menu!

It would be cool if they had TV's to hang and watch the game but no big deal.
author: Mike J.

description:
The Berkeley Vegan is the best vegan pizza I've ever tried.  It is full of flavor, a crispy crust and the right sauce and spices to make it super tasty, even if you, like myself, are not a Diaya cheese fan (under other circumstances I usually can't stand it).  I order the Berkeley with added pineapples.  My family loves to eat it too whenever they are in town.  

Another vegan option is the Yuppie Sub sandwich without cheese and adding their Diaya.  That is so good as well, especially the caramelized onions.  They have a good selection of pizzas for anyone (and if you don't like pizza, you can have a sandwich or salad).  

The restaurant itself is very casual and they tend to play good classic rock music.  The staff is always friendly.  

One thing I don't love about this place is that they no longer offer delivery in my area.  I haven't eaten at Zpizza in a long time as a result.  Customer service mentioned other delivery options but when I searched for them there was a message that the delivery was not available (this was at 7 pm).  They must miss out on a lot of customers because of there lack of delivery.  There have been many times I would have ordered from them but didn't because I didn't want  the tedious MUNI ride down (I have to take two connections to get there).  It is in SoMa and I am in Lower Nob Hill (about a mile away?), so I don't understand why they don't deliver here anymore.
author: Teresa K.

description: In my opinion, this is hands-down the best New York style pizza in San Francisco! The staff is friendly and they keep the restaurant clean.  The summer-of-love music and decor are a huge plus. LOVE zpizza!
author: Marcia R.

description:
Found this place from a google search. Came here for the first time yesterday.
Kinda small, not very busy. But the place was clean and the staff was pretty friendly. We ordered some of the parmesean Flatbread sticks, which were pretty delicious. We also ordered a large pizza, half pepperoni and half "all american". The food came quickly. I like their crust because I prefer a softer, easier to chew crust. I wasn't much of a fan of the all American. The pepperoni was good, but nothing too special. And the soda machine needed to be changed because a few sodas had no mixture, just carbonated soda water..
I would be willing to try them again at some point down the road.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I'm impressed. I skipped the way crappy food at Moscone and thought I'd get a quick slice of less than stellar pizza. I was wrong! 

I ordered the special - a slice, side salad and drink for $6.95 and it's a great value. I went with a slice of veggie and Caesar.  The pizza was far better than I expected. The salad was the highlight - way fresh lettuce, big slices of parmesan cheese and good dressing along with some crispy bread slices. 

If you're in the area and are looking for a quick bite, this is the place! 

I should also add they've got free wifi, a cool 70's rock decor and play some decent tunes.
author: Andy K.

description:
I love the pizza. Their vegan pizzas are always hot and delicious and the crust is excellent: not too thick, not too thin. Tastes just like a normal pizza, but vegan. 

My only qualm would be that they don't deliver past market street and that their pizza is so expensive. Considering I have to get post mates to deliver also adds on an extra 10$, making this a big treat for it to be so expensive. 

Overall, delicious pizza, good vibe, and friendly staff.
author: Jesse B.

description: Solid pizza with lots of options for dairy or gluten free. I had the classic pepperoni and the diner I was with had the vegetarian. The staff was very patient and knowledgeable about dietary restrictions
author: Stephen H.

description: Won't deliver to a hotel. Dumbest thing I've ever heard of. Oh well. I'll buy from somewhere that will
author: Blaine A.

description: Great place to grab a slice and a beer. Good pie, good beer and Hendrix pouring out of the ceiling.
author: Mike J.

description: Solid spot. The service is beyond measures! I Keep coming back because the staff is great. They have the best meatball subs. You gotta try one.
author: Terese V.

description: Really tasty by the slice pizza at an affordable price. Plus they're even quick about delivering it to your table, even if it's like my experience where virtually every table was full and there was a line outside the door. Cullinary-wise this is the highlight of my trip so far.
author: Nicholas R.

description: Liked this place. Came here with my coworkers for lunch today. I ordered Italian pizza - ham, basil, artichoke, just right amount of cheese and juice - great pizza. May be a little under-salted for my taste, but hey, there is a salt on the table - can always add more if needed. Service is pretty quick, the space itself is on the ground floor of the parking garage, don't expect luxurious facilities, but it's an ok fast food place with good pizza.
author: Jeff M.

description:
zpizza has the honest, good pizza that I would expect from the east coast.  In fact, ate slices like theirs in Philly at least once a week.

Mind you, they have much more exotic options, and you can really be creative with the pizza.

It's likely I'll be back because it's a solid option when looking for lunch.

The person who took our order was really friendly and even helped when I was trying to make a route to Japantown.

Oh, and the restroom requires the key from behind the counter.
author: Nobuyuki S.

description: We saw this spot while trying to find a good restaurant to eat and we decided to give it a try. Boy, am I glad we did! Great service and AMAZING pizza. I ordered the Mexican pizza for myself and 2 sisters and we were licking our fingers at the end. Great service and the best pizza I've had in ages. Can't wait to come back!
author: Nyssa K.

description:
Can 180 people be wrong?  Well, if they're the 180 reviewers who gave Zpizza an average 4-star rating, the answer is yes.

On the plus side:  I popped in at an off time (late afternoon, in between normal lunch and dinner hours), and the pizza-by-the-slice options were still all hot and fresh, with a few pies looking to be just out of the oven.  Maybe lucky timing, but still - when you're getting it by the slice, you can do worse.

The pizza itself, though, is almost the definition of generic:  the type of thinnish, anonymous crust you'd find on a Domino's pizza, not particularly chewy or flavorful.  Sauce, cheese and toppings all nothing special, just kind of there.  Not bad, but no distinguishing features either.  

In the end, mere convenience food.
author: Scott H.

description:
Won't deliver to hotels. Completely unreasonable about it and won't compromise even to meet downstairs to grab a prepaid order. This is despite a 20% tip on delivery for a $25 order. Super lame.

In the end I walked and picked up the pizza. I was not impressed, maybe because I actually have had decent pizza (e.g. I don't live in California). I would give it 2.5 or maybe 3 stars, but the lack of delivery to my hotel, in an area of town that is frankly nothing BUT HOTELS keeps this place firmly in the 1-star, not my friend, zone.
author: Adina P.

description: Lines not too long, great seating easy to come by and the crust was thin and soft-crispy perfection. The cheese was oozy and the mushrooms were awesome. My pepperoni slice wasn't as exciting but the slices are  fairly medium to large, so my one slice was good enough. However, I was really hungry so I polished both slices off with lots of chili pepper and guilt. I like their choices of menu, of which mine was the two slices and fountain drink ($6.95), whereas there was one slice, side salad and drink for the same price. I didn't feel like eating greens, so... next time!
author: Sharon B.

description:
They deliver and the pizza is great. Friendly delivery folks. 

Would definitely order again.
author: Mimosa A.

description:
I can't believe we just spent $30 (including, delivery, tax, tips) on a paper thin 14" gluten-free American pizza...
 
It wasn't bad, per se, but just way too pricey for what we received. 

I'll give them another chance with their regular crust. If it weren't for my gluten-free friend, I wouldn't have even considered going with the GF crust.
author: Colleen W.

description: Solid pizza.  Good cheese, fair sauce, fairly thin.  Clean place.  Wine and Beer.  Worth a look in the area.
author: Jeff J.

description: We had American pizza! The pizza and tomato sauce were sooo delicious! We will come back here for sure!!! Special Thanks to the the crew!!!!
author: Nasim K.

description: I found this place one day as I was walking to the mall. I decided to give it a try and really liked it. The pizza is good and we'll priced. What I really liked was there hot meatball sub. It's a nice comfortable place that has classic music with old records and photos on the wall. If you've never been here and looking for something good to eat give this place a try, I think you will enjoy it.
author: Luis L.

description:
Me and my wife Ordered a slice of pepperoni and a small box of italian pizza, very delicious and not very salty and the guy who works there gave us extra salad 

I would recommend this place
author: Carfel L.

description: Love love this place.  The pizza is soooo good.  Was staying at a local hotel and was tired and wanted something affordable and good to eat.  Tried to get here by cutting through the mall... which didn't work.  So we walked around and started walking to the resturant.  When I first saw it it looked small and iffy. There were people inside eating so we gave it a shot.  It was sooooo good.  Nice little place with lots of room to eat inside.  Restrooms for customers to use.  Staff was really friendly. Great find!!
author: Angela G.

description:
Yay for zpizza! They really improved their vegan pizza option. I tried the Berkeley Vegan again, and it was delectable. My friend and I ordered a large and gobbled it all up in no time. Cold bottles of Anchor Steam were the perfect accompaniment to our meal. 

The crust was thin and crisp. It featured an acceptable amount of vegetables, although I would have liked more. Close your eyes and picture a beautiful, bountiful salad (undressed, of course). Now imagine throwing that salad on top of a delicious, piping hot pizza. That's more of my speed, but I guess not everyone is as weird as I am. ;)

Minus .5 of a star because there were a few bare patches that could have used an extra sprinkle of Daiya, but that's a really minor detail. If you're in the mood for a yummy vegan pizza that doesn't make you feel like a glutton after two slices, this is a wonderful option.
author: Brandi W.

description: Wonderful service! The owners are very friendly. I drove into SF late and was starving.  I walked in 10 minutes before they closed but they still took my order.  PLUS...I snuck my little pup in there because I couldn't leave her in the hotel.  The lady didn't say anything! :)
author: Nikki P.

description: We are visiting from Texas, staying at Marquis Marriott. These dudes were so cool about our order. We ordered some pies pretty close to closing time and they were very helpful with our order. They don't deliver to hotels but I enjoyed the walk down there. It's a cool little pizza joint with some down to earth employees. They made sure I had plates and condiments for our entire group. Cheers from Texas, you guys make a mean pie and are classy!!
author: Joseph T.

description: Why, why, why, won't you put jalapeños on my 2 slices to go and charge me accordingly? Instead it's no, and 2 slices on a paper plate. And why doesn't anyone know how to use the word "literally"?
author: Neilo P.

description:
This was my first time eating here. I was randomly walking and felt hungry so I was super happy I saw zpizza since I'm a big pizza lover. I didn't look at the menu so I just got a pepperoni slice and a Cesar salad. They were both pretty good nothing really special.

Maybe their other options are better, I'd go back and try them if I'm around the area.
author: Cristina A.

description: Very delicious pizza! I've had both the regular and vegan options and being mildly lactose intolerant the Berkeley vegan hit the spot! I got it on wheat bread and the cheese tasted amazing along with all the different veggies and vegan burger crumbles. YUM! Definitely one of my new favorite places to grab pizza in the city. I had some of my friends regular cheese pizza and the cheese was to die for! Would definitely recommend this place, the staff is very friendly and the service is pretty quick only took 10-15 minutes for the pizza to be done!
author: Harumi C.

description:
This is a review for their catering services, which were great. 

I needed food for ~40 people with a variety of food concerns -- vegetarian, vegan, gluten free and zPizza was the ONLY place that could deliver all of that plus regular pizzas and salads for a great price. 

I thought the thai chicken pizza was great, and all the others were good too. Salads were fresh and yummy, and delivery was prompt. 

If you need cheap catering for a large group, I'd totally recommend zPizza!
author: Laura J.

description: Visiting San Fran and needed a place to grab a quick bite, kids suggested pizza and we found Zpizza was a quick walk away from our hotel. Pizza was delicious and service was also pleasant. Will probably become one of our go to spots next we visit!!
author: Renee S.

description:
A surprisingly good pizza place just opened at the Yerba Buena Garage right next to the new Good Vibrations, proving that if you can't satisfy one urge, you can satisfy another. What's more fulfilling than a four-speed vibrator with a blinking light? A thin-crust pizza, of course, with lots of fresh toppings. It's similar to Gialina's in Glen Park but more modest in execution. Jamie W. showed his resourcefulness by finding a $5 coupon online, so we went to town tonight. 

From the Classics side of the menu, we tried the $19.95 Large American Pizza, especially tasty since it was dominated by fresh tomato slices, bell peppers and red onions. It had a thin layer of organic tomato sauce and the regular kitchen-sink assortment of mozzarella, pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms (see photo). We wanted to try one of their zpizza creations, so we went for the $10.95 Small Casablanca, which tasted more Sicilian than Moroccan with roasted garlic sauce, mozzarella, ricotta, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, and Parmesan (see photo). It was zingy and a tad salty, but a small one was just the right chaser. 

I look forward to trying more in the future when they get more into their game. Like all new operations, the staff was green and enthusiastic, and we saw them gather around the creation of our pizzas like paisans-in-training. While pizza dominates the menu, they also serve salads, sandwiches, a couple of pastas and even a Mediterranean plate. This appears to be part of a big chain with franchises in even Saudi Arabia and Vietnam. Definitely a new fast-food destination for us... if only they were a little faster making their pizzas. Open until 10PM, a big plus. 

FOOD - 4 stars...satisfying pizza with fresh toppings and fire-baked flatbread crust 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...standard suburban mall-like look 
SERVICE - 3 stars...enthusiastic, hopefully they'll pick up the pace 
TOTAL - 4 stars...Pizza, Pizza!
author: Ed U.

description: Awesome pizza. We got the garlic chicken. It was great. The dough was perfect, the garlic sauce was just the right amount of garlic taste, the flavors complimented each other well. I can't wait to try the BBQ pizza next time we go
author: Ari M.

description: Got the vegan Berkeley. Decent, fresh but nothing to write home about. It might be a good place to satisfy all diets but I wouldn't make a special trip here.
author: Inês L.

description: We,2, ordered Large american pizza and ate all. Pear salad was okay, Pizza was fresh hot, yammy. And I actually liked the dough. thin, well toasted. I loved this place, the people are all nice, but I doubt I go here for dinner again. They have deal menus which look reasonable. Yeh it is just an average pizza place.
author: Erica K.

description: This is good pizza.  It's a small place with amazing music.  So far it's The doors and led zeppelin, so it makes the pizza taste even better.  I really liked their Gorgonzola and pear salad.  They have vegan options available too, for our vegan friends.  :)
author: Lucia M.

description:
I am still in love with Z Pizza, ate there for my birthday..
The staff there is great The young man that always helps me when I come in (Andy is his name me thinks) is great always listen and helps me pick out the best pizza choices
The best part of Z Pizza to me is that they have Gluten free Crust as well as the normal crust (I am Gluten free For health reasons) 
I love me some Z Pizza and am a loyal fan I refuse to eat pizza from any place else
oh yeah the store it self is just so cute and comfy
author: Babie S.

description: Workers were very friendly and accommodating to me diet restrictions but I've had much better gluten free vegan pizza before. It was okay but not worth $14 for a personal pizza.
author: Regina A.

description: Pizza was killer (vegan cheese with veggies). So many topping options!!!! Service was super cool. We tried to deliver from outside their zone but instead of hanging up the guy started recommending other places near us to order from - super cool. I thanked him and had him change my order to pickup. When we got there they were closing in minutes but we chatted and left happy.
author: Brian P.

description:
Pizza was great! Everything else was just good

Four star because it was quick, easy and smooth.

Could be a little more professional. Employee walked in to start his shift, set his backpack down and charged me for my pickup. He was nice but I felt like I was at a snack shop or something.
author: Johnathan E.

description:
Nom, nom, nom. After 18 hours of travelling, dodgy plane food (one of my GF meals was served still frozen complete with ice crystals), and trying to adjust to SF time, I needed good food. After a wander around my temporary hood, I hit Yelp as I was praying I could get GF pizza and found Zpizza close by. 

It's pretty non-descript but it serves GF, Vegan and regular pizza. I didn't want anything too fancy (been awake for 25hrs) so a small cheese & tomato was just the thing. GF pizza can be hit and miss but this was lovely! Uber thin and crispy with a hint of chewiness, it didn't last long. $15 for pizza and a large pepsi (alcohol is available) which I thought was great and hopefully I'll get the chance to head back before I head home.
author: Claire L.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE Z PIZZA!

Every time I come here I get the same thing.  Two pizza slice lunch special and drink.  The two pizza slices usually are something they have thrown together, including vegetarian friendly.

Price on these single special ranges from $6.95-$9.95, sandwiches are really good too!  Especially the curry chicken sandwich which is amazing!

Service, what more can I say, I always feel like I get taken care of when I go here!  They have a quick service model, so you order at the counter they bring it out to you.

Food:  Really Really GOOD!  Fresh taste to it, nothing tastes frozen, it really hits the spot if you are looking for a pizza that just has a strong good taste to it.  Not overly filling, but I personally like it that way.  Seeing as I hate being tired after a lunch.
author: Jon G.

description:
Vegan pizza rocks. Nothing like vegan meat and vegan cheese on a pizza. Sure, it's not the best pizza in the world, but for what they usually offer vegans, this rocks my socks off. 

Not a lot of great seating areas -- it's no round table -- but good people watching.
author: Ari F.

description:
My office lunch runs often take me to Westfield and this is one spot that piques my interest when I'm walking back to my office.  It's occupies a retail space in the popular 5th Street/Mission Street garage.  After picking up a few items at Bristol Farms, I walked in and perused the menu board.  The $3.95 special, a slice of pizza and fountain drink, seemed like the appropriate choice for my initial visit.  I chose the sausage and mushroom (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zpizza-san-francisco?select=yF9fzMYnFJkkhpqzwGGvOg#yF9fzMYnFJkkhpqzwGGvOg) and filled my cup with a mixture of iced tea and lemonade (Arnold Palmer, to those who aren't familiar).  While filling my cup, the efficient cashier placed my slice in the oven for approximately three minutes.
Taking this meal to go, he packed it nicely in a mini pizza box, which prevented the hated "pizza stuck to wax paper" Let's be real here as the pizza quality itself probably rates 3-stars to those pie gourmands.  If you're in the neighborhood seeking a quick, cheap bite (less than $5.00?!), this is probably one of  your better options.
author: Mike C.

description: The service was great! The manager was very knowledgable and helped me navigate the menu with an allergy to gluten and dairy. We'll be back and recommend it to friends.
author: Camela T.

description: vegan pizza!! im a fan. we are new here & almost no place in Houston offers a vegan cheese option. so that sucks when you have a dairy allergy & want PIZZA! we'll be ordering again.
author: Taylor N.

description: Stopped here for dinner, and boy were we glad we did.  We did a medium garlic chicken pizza and it was fantastic.  One of the best pizzas I have had in a while, certainly one of the best on this side of the country.  I will definitely visit this restaurant when I am back in San Fran.
author: Lester G.

description:
It's a good downtown pizza spot, albeit a little hidden among the parking structure.

The ingredients are fresh.  

Try the Rusticas.

They're in my rotation of places to eat around my workplace radius.
author: John M.

description: Great pizza.  Friendly staff.  Excellent music being played in the restaurant.  I will definitely go back.
author: Matt D.

description:
Disclaimer- I'm from Brooklyn. I know pizza. And now you think I'm obnoxious, but I don't care. =P

Best pizza I've had in SF hands down. Suffice it to say that I've actually visited them several times in a week. It's that good, and it's that affordable. 

The staff there are super polite, the pie/slice options are fantastic. But you know you've got just darned good pizza when plain 'ole cheese will do it for you.
author: Frances A.

description: This is by far the best pizza I have had in SF!!! They have everything from organic customizable pizza to sandwiches and calzones. It isn't even that expensive! As someone coming from NYC, this pizza is amazing!!!
author: Rob G.

description:
Meh. Dough not cooked, crust not crunchy, tasteless toppings. Go somewhere else if you want a good pizza. If you're looking a pizza for home parties... Maybe this place is fine. Or not.

EDIT: I got it delivered, and I know things can lose flavor and texture when it gets home.

Still Meh though.

Cheers
author: Antonin M.

description: I loved the pizza here!! This is a great place to go if you want to get away from the crowds on Market Street. Prices are great and food was delish!!!!
author: Amy C.

description:
Cool little find by happenstance. Happened to be in the City for a conference and went for a walk during lunch break.

Saw this listing on Yelp, walked by, and it smelled delicious. I walked in, heard some good classic rock and decided to try it out.

Had a lunch special - slice of pizza, salad and drink. Very reasonable pricing, the food was excellent, and the beer was cold and Italian... What more could I ask for!

Also, they have a pretty cool collection of albums, album covers and classic rock art as decor.

Check it out when in the area.
author: Roger N.

description:
Pros:
1) less than $4 per slice
2) it seems that when they shmear sauce on the pizza, they leave a lil extra towards the outside of the pie. That's great b/c the crust doesn't feel dry if you it it with that extra sauce.
3) I like their chili flakes
4) I had a bunch of stuff and my bike when I went and I really liked that they let me bring my bike in and didn't call me out for it. Bonus star for that!
5) Dependable, affordable NY style pizza place in a pizza desert that is called SOMA (minus gourmet pizzas like Del Popolo / Zero Zero)

Cons:
1) You have to add a lil salt to the pizza slices here, I find them a bit under salted.
author: Neeharika B.

description:
We received a coupon for zpizza in our mailbox and decided why not check it out. Turns out it is now my favorite place for delivery. 

You can order online and specify what kind of pizza you want down to the half. I.e. You can make a pizza with half garlic oil with vegan cheese while the other half contains regular mozzarella and tomato sauce. It's a bit complicated but the best part is, if you make a complicated pizza, a friendly zpizza employee will call to make sure they are making exactly what you want! 

Other things that make me love this pizza are the option for whole wheat crust as well as fresh basil and cilantro at no extra cost!
author: Jaedra D.

description: So last night I ordered a pizza, my card got charged. But it never came. So I called today and told them about how I never got my pizza, and the guy  said they called and called but I never answered. So he refused to give me a new pizza or give my money back. If there was a problem with communication, my address is on my order. They could've broughten up, my landlord would've called me. And it could've ended. He told me after an argument he'll cancel the transaction, so it worked in the end.
author: Priscilla H.

description:
This is a staple pizza at any Tech Meetup group in San Francisco it seems. I've eaten their pizza 5-6 times at Yelp HQ for the monthly Designers + Geeks Meetup Group and last night finally made it out to their location. 

Parking was cheap and easy. $1.50/hr at the City garage right above. I had the Mexican pizza - one of my favorite. Cheese, chicken, onion, and avocado goodness. There is also one with blue cheese and pear I really love too.

My younger brother from Calgary (Canada) was in absolute heaven:
Vegan cheese and vegan meat stuff makes this great for folks (like my brother) with dietary restrictions. I guess vegan cheese on a pizza is unheard of in Calgary. I should also mention there are Gluten free options also.

Lastly what I love is the price. This place is affordable. It's not hipster fancy pizza, but just simple take out every week type pizza that is a wedge above many other places in the same category.
author: Chris S.

description:
Organic?  That's great.  I'm down for anything with organic components.  Gluten-free?  Now that may take a second.  So far any gluten-free food I've ingested tastes like toothpaste, rubber, tree bark, or clearly didn't resemble the flavor described.  At first sight, gluten-free was my first word association with Zpizza.  

I saw this particular Zpizza walking by after a night downtown.  Did some Google investigating and found out this organization originated in Southern California.  Their aim is to serve pizza with "fresh" and "healthier" ingredients.  They also have the option that I dread, gluten-free.   

They serve by the slice and pizzas by the whole, along with some sandwiches.  The feel exudes of a variant of Pizza My Heart.  Among the variety of nicknamed choices, I got a small Mexican.  The small serves one to two people, as the pizza did just that.  Satisfying wouldn't be a good word to describe it, but it filled the tank.  There weren't "healthy" side effects that changed the flavor.  The thin crust pizza was sliced into four quarter pieces and the ingredients appeared fresh as advertised with only the sour cream being a little suspect.        

I would grab a slice from here again if I'm in a hurry and in the vicinity.  Without that statistical event involved, chances are slim I'll actually return.  Zpizza does deliver a healthier option, but there's just something about healthy pizza that doesn't cut it when appraising levels of taste.  As much as I appreciate their pitch, the pizza is only average tasting.
author: Arnold T.

description: We ordered gluten free pepperoni pizza and a gluten free southwest chicken pizza.  They were ordered well before the 45-60 min estimate and they were piping hot when they got here, which I love.  The pizza was about as good as GF pizza can be - the dough just isn't the same but that's just the nature of GF.  I like that they have a lot of GF options here.  Will definitely order again.
author: Negar A.

description: I missed my GGT bus so I headed over here for a quick bite (2 slices of the daily special plus a fountain drink for $6.95+tax). I wasn't expecting much because I know this is a chain and I think thin crust is usually not filling enough for me, but it was pretty tasty (better than average, warm, and fresh-tasting though it had been sitting in the display area next to the cashier). Plus the blonde guy with long hair working there was really nice and brought me the bathroom key when I realized it was locked! So +10 customer service points. Basically great for a quick lunch and not too greasy/little portions for pizza=)!!
author: Jenny L.

description: Awesome pizza experience. Love the music and the owner and staff are awesome. Thanks for making my first San Francisco pizza perfect.
author: David W.

description: Excellent pizza and excellent service. Came here after arriving to San Fransisco and I was starving. This place hit the spot and then some! I would highly suggest it to anyone.
author: Spencer E.

description:
Good pizza, but despite a long, trouble-free order history, they decided my building isn't nice enough to deliver to anymore. So much so that the restaurant just cancelled an order I'd placed and paid for through Eat24 rather than deliver it to me.

Before you order, make sure they will deliver to your specific building.
author: Ted S.

description: Awesome!!! It's very reasonable in price and the pizza is really good! The Service is good too! They know what their customers want inexpensive yummy pizza :)
author: T D.

description:
Yum! After a busy morning of meetings out manger decided to order us lunch from Z's and I'm so glad she did! With vegan and gluten-free options all our team members were munching happily on all sorts of tasty bites.

Personally, I devoured several slices of the gluten-free with cheese and it was absolutely the tastiest gluten-free pizza I've ever had the pleasure of eating. I don't know what their secret is, but instead of being corn meal-ish or super crunchy, this crust was perfect. It basically tasted like a perfect thin crust. Great sauce and just the right amount of cheese. Our group are more of this than any other!

They also delivered some exceptional salads (including a pear/walnut combination that was amazing) and seriously tasty hummus. This was delivery perfection!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Had a phenomenal piece of the Tuscan pizza (delicious), a "small" California salad (outstanding) and a Red Trolley beer. Here on business, and would definitely go again while I'm here should the opportunity present itself.

And honestly, the pizza was as fresh as I've ever had. Fantastic.
author: Frank A.

description: Excellent cheeses pizza!  Do not get the pizza by slice, ask them to make it fresh and order a small pizza.  It's absolutely fantastic!!!! Very tasty sauce and great pizza.  Again if you get the pizza that has been sitting there for 30 minutes, it won't be the same taste!!!
author: Victor D.

description:
Z'  PIZZA with a PASSION, at Zpizza. 

Sampling Zpizza's "Casablanca"  ... .MAGNIFICO. "Casablanca" crisp crust, populated profusely with garlic, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes & yes, marvelous mozzarella. Also, the usually boring Peperoni pizza, with PURE peperoni - not polluted with preservatives and so forth is promulgated by Zpizza. 

Zpizza has both feet, both hands in the "organic" food movement, which they bring to all aspects of their Pizza Pies. Pondering pizza with an "organic" approach is usually not a source of prolific pontification, but "it all comes together" in the pies this pizza joint produces.   

Why 5 stars? they are on the street level of the 5th/Mission garage. Many a fancy folk (OK, some not so fancy) diners seek out the food court across the street. Including our local revered reviewer who publishes prolifically. 

Zpizza makes great pizza's complemented by great service. A great gastronomic experience by pizza providers who care.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
This turned-out to be a good spot for pizza.

I had a slice of the cheese pizza, which was good and had a good amount of richness from the cheese.  I also tried a slice of the pepperoni, which was also good - the meat added a nice punch of flavor.  The BBQ chicken salad sounded good and it arrived as a big portion, enough to satisfy a hungry craving.  The chicken would have been better if it had been grilled, but it was still a good salad.
author: Ken G.

description:
It's usually good to to a Yelp event with a little food already in your belly. And so it was last night as I left the Westfield Center and headed towards Radius at 7th and Folsom. The "Anonymous"-related helicopters were in the air and as I passed zpizza, a slice and a beer sounded pretty good. 

The zpizza space itself is a bit underwhelming, but boy was my slice delicious and a pleasant surprise. Service was quick and friendly, and the price was reasonable. I also enjoyed reading all the buzz words (e.g., gluten free, organic, etc.) and wondering if these guys really knew what they were talking about.
author: Eric B.

description:
Nice crew, meh pizza.

Came here with another friend from NY, our pizza standards are probably higher than most people who've mostly lived west of the Mississippi. But a few California pizza places make pretty decent replicas of a good pizza, such as "Escape from NY" and the Paxtis chain, so I'm endlessly hopeful there are more. Unfortunately, "zpizza" is your basic California pizza- tasteless and excessive crust, mediocre and too much cheese, a few toppings... almost as an afterthought. You will get filled up here, but only your stomach and not your heart. 

The service people were friendly and more than helpful at bringing food and taking away dishes, there's a star or two just for them. And their Greek Salad was a notch above the usual fare at most pizza joints. But when the pizza quality is not far above Chuckie Cheese calibre it's a shame to see the talent wasted.  Seems this place is a chain or franchise so doubtful much can be done on that front, but I guess if you want a nice place to sit and listen to old rock hits and sip a drink then you could do much worse in this area.
author: T J.

description:
ZPizza is AMAZING!

Their customer service is 10-stars! They're always able to pull together last minute catering orders for me on the spot. I'm not even talking about last minute for about 20 people...I'm talking about last minute emergency food for 200 starving engineers! They deliver the pizzas on time and with all the required utensils, plates, cheeses, etc. They're always willing to label all the pizzas including the name and whether or not they are vegan, vegetarian or meat. Their pricing is very reasonable too. 

They have a huge selection of pizzas and salads on their menu but there are a few that are always requested:

PIZZAS
Mexican
Sausage and Mushroom
Casablanca 
Chicken Sausage & Arugula
Pear and Gorgonzola 
Vegan

SALADS
Arugula
Pear and Gorgonzola

The pizzas are flavorful and not greasy. I don't feel guilty for eating pizza all the time when it's from them! 

Special shout out for the Vegan pizza. We have some strict diets in the office and at our events and everyone always says that the Vegan is delicious.

I've never eaten at the actual restaurant, but their delivered food is delicious and always delivered with a smile. :)
author: Julia A.

description:
Wow thanks for calling to cancel my order that was processed **1** minute late. Even though the order was placed several minutes before.

If you want to close so early on a weekday, maybe you should stop accepting delivery orders sooner!!
author: J E.

description: Thanks for the reviews as agree this is much better pizza by the slice than Blondies! Thin with lots of cheese.
author: Mike S.

description:
We were so pleased to find this healthy and convenient pizza place in San Fran. It was so good we ordered 3 times. We had the regular and Gluten Free and it was awesome. The guy was so helpful to us tourists too!!! 
Thanks and well be back before we leave town.
author: Amanda W.

description: Stopped in for a quick lunch yesterday.  They had me with the classic rock playing as I walked in... But the pizza was great, this coming from a transplanted New Yorker that has had some awesome pizza over the years.... Had the $6.95 pizza slice / salad / drink combo.  Food was great! Nice sauce, cheese and crust.   The price was very good.  Staff was great... some of them looked to be native Cali surfer dudes .... but knew how to run a pizza restaurant !!   Doubt they really do much surfing tho..... not at Ocean Beach SF anyway.... .
author: Patrick C.

description:
The bacon bleu pizza is delicious!! Definitely the best takeout pizza place in soma, hands down.

The delivery service is hit or miss. The guy taking your order is pretty rude but they delivery the pizza to your door pretty fast. 

One annoying thing: they wont accept thier own zpizza generated coupon through their online ordering system; the coupon needs to be printed out and handed to the delivery guy.
author: CL S.

description: Great pizza place that delivers in very reasonable time, even on a BIG fight night! Way better than roundtable.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
World War Z.

Not good for humans: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcwTxRuq-uk

Also not good for humans: If there was just one slice left of the Berkeley Vegan pizza with marinara sauce, vegan cheese, veggie burger crumbles and veggies.

It's an impressive amount of flavor and relatively healthy. Humans have battled over religion and oil. We might fight over this.

Same goes for the Pollo Latino sandwich. Marinated lime chicken breast that actually tastes like lime, lettuce, salsa and avocado on a baguette.

One bite left? Let's duel.

Assuming no shortages you can walk out the door for about $20 for both (small pie is six slices). Probably won't be that easy, as there are so many good looking options.

But if there isn't enough to go around? Wars have been fought over much sillier things.
author: Jason B.

description:
Their Gluten Free pizza crust is the best in town, and trust me, I've tried them all. Its not spongey, overly doughy or crispy like many Gluten Free Crusts, its just right -thin, crunchy and delicious. 

This place is a hidden gem, even with their large menu and delicious product, its never too busy and I can always fit it into my lunch break. 

I've only had very positive experiences with the guys working there too. They all seem to be very nice and helpful too. 

Thanks Z-Pizza!
author: Stephen R.

description:
Well done! As a GF pizza person, it is not often that you can be traveling and find a place that offers the option, much less one that does it so well. Frankly, it makes me jealous of those who can lunch in SF that they have this place available to them.

My selection was the ZBQ Chicken, which was both smoky and sweet without being overpowering.  The crust was nuce and crisp, and collapsed appropriately when given too many toppings on the tip. Bravo!
author: Chris S.

description:
My visit was dissapointing from beginning to end.

It started with me standing in front of the counter while the guy was on the phone. Either he was on hold or the person on the other end was talking non-stop cause the guys just stood there with the phone to his ear. No acknowledgement taht I was waiting...not a nod, or even holding up a finger to say just a moment. i could hear someone moving around in the back, but he didn't call them to help me either.

After 3-4 minutes he finished the call then he asked what I wanted. No apolgy for keeping me waiting. When a place gives priority to a person on the phone instead of the person with cash standing in front of them you know you are in trouble.

I ordered a slice and a soda and sat down to wait for my pizza.

A few minutes later the guy brought over a slice that had been heated to the point where the cheese was dark brown. It was bland and had the gritty feel of corn meal on the underside of the crust (this seems to be very common in San Francisco)

The pizza was as good as a quality frozen pie and that's about it. The top right corner of my slice had no cheese or sauce on it and was just an overheated mound of bread.

The salt and pepper shakers were sticky and there was no oregano in the condiment baskets.

there is much better pizza in SF than zpizza. I'll take bad service with great pizza and I'll take great service with mediorce pizza, but nothing is worth poor service and bland pizza.
author: joe f.

description: We ordered a pizza, half pepperoni and half Hawaiian.  The pizza was average and quite filling, so I'll give 3 stars. The service was excellent, so I'll bump it up a star.
author: Larry H.

description:
Relatively quick pizza, with some pretty tasty looking salads.  I got a large pear-gorgonzola; good fruit, excellent walnuts, and fine cheese.

Salads come in large flat containers --- perhaps to stack nicely with slice boxes?  

I waited too long to dig into my slice of Napoli pizza --- eat your slices there, don't walk back to the office.
author: Ken M.

description:
Service here left a little to be desired for (I guess they were short-staffed and had to open 30-45 minutes late), but the pizza was fresh and delicious. I shared a large vegan Berkeley pizza with someone and it was barely big enough for our (starving) stomachs. Under more normal circumstances, I think a large  would suffice for 2 adults. 

Anyway, the pizza was delicious. It was loaded with fresh, crisp vegetables and a soy meat topping. The Daiya/vegan cheese was great--they put on the perfect amount. The crust was thin but not overly-so. I would definitely go back here again because of the quality of the pizzas here. I have also tried non-vegan options at other zpizza locations and I can always count on delicious, fresh pizza.
author: Jazzy O.

description:
Being gluten free, Pizza is not something I get to enjoy much very often.  And most of the places that offer gluten free pizza are not that good.  That's why I was a little reluctant to believe all the hype about Z Pizza when I heard they made Gluten Free Pizza and were part of a chain.  Even when I checked out the website they were pitching buying a franchise.  I was pleasantly surprised by the Pizza being as good as it was.  The pizza was fresh made where as some places that offer gluten free seem to be pre-made.  There were plenty of choices for toppings and were fresh.

Now for the bad.  You can only get a small pizza gluten free and it's going to cost about $15, which isn't cheap.  We guessed one wouldn't be enough for my wife and I and fortunately we ordered two.  We ordered the American and the Santa Fe, both of which were tasty.  The pizzas were small and I'd have liked some more sauce and toppings, but they are small and that's they only size they come.  At least it's one more option for my diet and I won't be doing it all the time due to the expense, but for a once in while treat it's not bad and I'm sure we'll be back to try some of their other options.

We had the Pizzas delivered so I can't tell you about the restaurant.  Also know they charge $2 for delivery, which I didn't find out if the restaurant keeps or the delivery guys gets.
author: Scott L.

description: Worst location I've been to, had to pick up the pizza because they don't deliver two blocks away. Pizza tasted old, like it wasn't made fresh and had been sitting in the warmer. Not going to return to this Z, I usually love their pizzas and they have always been fresh and hot in the past! What the hay :(
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Regardless of what people say, there is some great pizza in SF. But this isn't one of them. 
I've had better pizza at a snack bar. 
Canned sauce and brought in frozen dough. It's pretty easy to tell right away.
author: Charlie V.

description: The Glutten free pizza with the vegan cheese was the best I ever had. Went here before the Megadeth show i informed the gentleman  I needed a Glutten Free Crust I told him what topping I wanted and he informed me that some of the sausage had glutten in it so he saved me a lot of pain later on.
author: Christopher H.

description:
The first time we went to Z Pizza, it honestly wasn't the best time. We wanted to order a vegan pizza and found this place. I liked they have gluten free crust and go beyond the usual veggie pizza. 
We were told our pizza would take about 15 minutes which we didn't mind. After almost 30 minutes I was ready to ask about the food. What my partner noticed that I didn't, was that the waiter gave two men who were dining in, OUR pizza.
We knew it was ours, it had the exact ingredients we ordered. When I walked up to the cashier he and the waiter pretty much knew they made a mistake.

So the two guys are busy eating OUR pizza and had already ordered TWO of their own. Honestly shows what kind of greedy fucks they are and how they are inconsiderate of other customers. To anyone that thinks it's okay to eat someone else's food, realize your selfishness is the reason they have to wait longer...pray someone doesn't slap their food out of your hand. Be considerate folks.

But since we are cool, laid back folks, we knew their mistake could've been easily resolved had the other customers said it wasn't their food. Soooooo we didn't hold it against them.

While waiting, the cashier gave us some drinks so we were cool. We thought after an hour, let's eat here only to find they were closing. They were fine with us staying but honestly I wanted to eat home. So we left.

A week or so later, we returned to Z Pizza, hoping for a different experience. Food was on time, no greedy fucks to eat food they didn't order so we went home.
