Here's the thing, their CRUST is too thin and flimsy. They did NOT cut the slices evenly. My pieces were too big and my partner's were too small. I've had better pizza, thin and thick. And we both felt a little sick afterwards, so based on our second experience, we will not be returning. I know there's better somewhere else. We didn't finish the pizza and gave it to a homeless woman. I am not sure if that was the right thing to do! 

If you are not looking for much out of a pizza, this may be the place for you. Please beware of the greedy fucks at this restaurant and others. lol
author: Ray B.

description: This terrific local pizza joint near the Moscone Center hit the spot on more than one occasion when I was in town for a conference. Whether you order a small pie or just a slice, you're in for some outstanding pizza. Good stuff!
author: Joe P.

description: This is a pretty decent lunch option if you work nearby. Unlike the food courts at westfield and the metreon, this place doesn't get crowded. Pizza is mediocre but service is fast and friendly.
author: Diana G.

description: YUMMY!!! I love the non-traditional pizza options. The flavors are great and you can tell they use quality ingredients. This was my first experience but I'll definite order from here again.
author: Jeanine G.

description:
This is the absolute best pizza in the city, and may be the best in the world. The gluten free pizza made me tingle. The staff is also quite nice. 

Do yourself a favor and zpizza!!!
author: Sara M.

description: I had a groupon so I made a special trip to try this place out. They serve a decent variety of your pizza joint foods. Me and my buddy had the supersub, Calzone, pepperoni pizza, and pear & walnut salad. The highlight was definitely the salad it had a good balance between the tarty sweetness of the pears and the crunch of the walnuts. The supersub along with the pizza and calzone weren't bad but the servings are a bit small and the bread to cheese/meat ratio could've been better. They follow the recipe guide for these dishes but I don't taste anything that would make me slap my momma. Service was friendly and the place is clean so I'll give it a good 3-3.5 stars.
author: Norris T.

description: This place is fantastic. As our family can only eat gluten free, so it's a real treat to find a place that can do any pizza gluten free. The service is great and the management is top notch. The manager went above and beyond to insure that everything was perfect. I would recommend to anyone visiting the city.
author: Nate A.

description:
Shortly after I posted my previous review, I got a message from the owner apologising for my experience. He explained the mix up -- due to ordering both tomato and BBQ sauce on my base, the order was mis-read and I ended up with BBQ chicken on it. An understandable mistake that anyone could make.

He offered to let me try the California pizza again, this time without chicken, and with tomato and BBQ sauce on the base. I ordered it today, and it was delicious. The combination of the two sauces on the base was fantastic -- I wish more places let me do this! The cheese is very tasty, and the toppings were generous. I'm glad that I got another chance to try this pizza, and appreciate the owner reaching out.

I will definitely be going back for this pizza!
author: Gary M.

description: It's located in a convenient area, the service is friendly and chill, and they don't skimp out on the toppings. A slice of pizza and a drink lunchtime combo will run you less than $7 which isn't bad at all. The Bacon Blue is bomb!
author: Nate W.

description:
1.  I may have made a mistake in ordering pasta instead of pizza.

2.  Based on reviews, I had high expectations.

3.  Ordering on Grubhub.com is easy.

4.  Penne with Meatballs - The penne was very bland.  I believe it was cooked in unsalted water.  Their was very little marinara sauce.  This is unfortunate.  Their sauce was the best part of the meal.  The meatballs were just generic and relatively plain meatballs.  I added some Parmesan, salt, and crushed red pepper from my cupboard and it perked it up some. 

5. Parmesan Flatbread Sticks - These were hard and the Parmesan tasted burned.  The side of marinara was very good though.

6.  Garlic Bread - This was pretty good garlic bread.  It was a nice mix of soft and crisp.  Just the right amount of garlic to let you know you are eating garlic bread without hitting you over the head with it.

7.  There were no beverages on their delivery menu.

8.  Delivery was very prompt, professional, and polite.

9.  Since folks have reviewed their pizza well, I may try them again and order their Napoli Pizza.  It is a tough call.  There are so many places to check out.

10.  This is a review of delivery from zpizza.
author: Mark D.

description:
So full and happy right now.

I recently had to give up gluten and it is horrible to live without bread and pizza. I've tried other gluten free pizzas and been disappointed each time. I read some good reviews of Zpizza's gluten free pizza and decided to give it a shot. Oh I am so glad I did! So crisp, so good. 

Bonus points since I ordered delivery and it was still hot upon arrival.
author: laura f.

description: Probably the best delivered pizza I've had in SF. It always arrives within a reasonable timeframe and is hot and tasty. Still tastes good the next day too - and the day after, when it lasts.
author: Kira G.

description:
I have ordered their pizza for our office on numerous times, actually waiting for them to open so I can place a order for today, and they are always spot on. I'm from Philadelphia - where you get real traditional pizza - you can't expect that kind of pizza from Z Pizza...that is not their product.  They started in Laguna Beach for God's sake. Read their site's About Us.....think Luigi's Pizza in S. Philly can say the same thing? Nope....so we can't expect it.  

The ZPizza in San Ramon is my favorite (close to home) and I rarely have pizza from anywhere else.
author: Michael S.

description: Zpizza is really good standard pizza. Not quite as thin as new york style, but getting there.
author: Clint M.

description: It was good.  It was really worth the 3.95 pizza and drink you get.  Too bad it's far from me but I would definitely frequent this place if it was closer.   4 dollar meals in SF downtown are not that common.   Especially with a fountain drink and good ingredients.
author: Homer S.

description:
Update: Within minutes of posting my review was contacted by the owner Andy who was incredibly nice and apologetic.  He said they must have had a broken heater bag and not know about it.  He even offered to take care of our next order.

Big thumbs up for great customer service!  Sounds like we just got a bit unlucky during our first experience, but we'll definitely give it another go soon.

---------

Ordered two XL pizzas for a party last night.  We're just down the street in SOMA.  Pizza arrived in 40 minutes which was pretty decent for a Saturday night in the city.  Unfortunately it was COLD.  Luke warm would probably be generous.

We threw the pizzas out on the table and people started to grab slices only to realize that they were about to eat cold pizza.  Enthusiasm quickly went down.  We collected everyone's slices and tried to figure out how to fit the two monsters into our not monster oven.  We had our anxious eaters wait another 20 minutes and served them warm pizzas.  Fortunately they were good!  Wheat crust for the win.

So my tip to zpizza: if I wanted a bake-my-own I would have gone to Whole Foods.  Pizza  should be HOT upon delivery.  We would have gladly waited longer to have our pizza come earlier in a later, shorter delivery round.
author: Parsons M.

description: Great location nearby hotels and shopping, it was only a block away from my hotel it was about a five minute walk. I ordered pizza on Super Bowl and it only took 20 minutes to make and pick up more.  All other pizza locations were about a two hour wait. She was able to explain many of the items to me over the phone because I wasn't familiar with their menu. She had great customer service when I walked in as well, asked if I needed any additional plates napkins or peppers/cheese. The pizza tasted for great the only thing I would recommend is adding on additional items to their menu. Besides just salads, pizzas and bread sticks. I do recommend their breadsticks it's shaped in a pizza's pie but ask for extra sauce!
author: Alexandra Linette S.

description:
Delivery Service:  Order claimed an average time of 45 minutes.  I called at 55 in and was told they'd been super busy and would have it to me in 20.  I said that was disappointing.  Five minutes later they called back and said not only was the pie on its way, but they were comping the order.

The delivery dude reemphasized the apology with great sincerity.  Firmly refused to even accept a tip.

I mean, don't get me wrong, I'd sort of rather get fast delivery at full price.  But that was some solid customer service, right there.

Food:  And, crucially, the pizza was, despite being kind of late, still piping hot on arrival.  We got the vegan pizza with some pineapple, and peppers only on half.  Order was done up exactly as ordered, despite being kind of finicky, crust was perfect texture, vegan cheese was delicious.

So all told, A++ would buy again, man.  Soon, probably.
author: John H.

description:
Great stuff
A great place to take your kids for dinner they have great vegetable pizzas and cheese / pepperoni pizzas. Also they have great tasting gluten free crust. The employees are also very flexible about sharing pizzas half one kind half the other.

Enjoy your pizza!! ;)
author: Johnny R.

description:
Good quality pizza with fresh toppings. Benefits from a nice central location 

Cons: Staff are slightly rude
BBQ sauce tasted very sweet (own opinion)

Overall, nice small pizza joint
author: Greg R.

description:
Ordered a small California salad and small American pizza for delivery.  The small salad was pretty big, and ingredients were fresh.

The pizza was delicious!  Lots of cheese and fresh ingredients also.  Was hot when it arrived.

It was all delivered on time, and the delivery guy was super nice.  Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Rebecca J.

description: Really good pizza! Well-priced and very fresh ingredients. I had the Santa Fe and it was awesome! I really appreciated how evenly crafted the pizza was. The ingredients weren't just dumped on, but rather carefully placed evenly over the whole pie.
author: Robert H.

description: Delicious! Slices are priced reasonably. I enjoyed one slice of mushroom sausage so much that I ordered another.
author: Amber S.

description:
I just ordered 2 pizzas and a salad for a meeting and 4 people were plenty stuffed. The PROS great tasting pizza, organic ingredients, order-to-pick-up was only 15 mins.
The CONS delivery only till 12:30pm mid-week and their website breaks when you submit an order after that 12:30pm mark for delivery, rather than just telling you to choose the pick-up option. 
All in all, a great pizza option and I will be there again, this for a guy who's not a fan of pizza. Colleagues forced me into it this time around.
author: Waleed R.

description: There aren't a lot cheap lunch options around this area. For $6 or so you can get a slice of pizza and a drink. It's not the best pizza I've ever had but a great place for a quick lunch.
author: Carlos A.

description: Best pizza in SF. Cheap but great, I got the pepperoni and it was delicious. Friendly service.
author: Scott F.

description: Delicious gluten free pizza made and cooked to order. We had a pizza with ricotta, garlic, artichokes and some other goodies on it! The best tasting gluten free pizza I've ever had. More of a cafe/diner place than a restaurant. Prices reasonable.
author: Rachel B.

description: Amazing staff and amazing pizza!!! I enjoyed it so much. Almost felt like I was in New York all over again. I will definitely visit again when I'm back in San Francisco.
author: Crystal G.

description: Great place, gluten free pizza made to order and prepared quickly!
author: Don P.

description: Excellent gluten free crust with vegan cheese!! Pizza sauce delicious and pepperoni right amount of spice!
author: Lynn S.

description: This pizza literally just made us decide to move to San Francisco. We were 99% sure, then we ate their tomato/mushroom/basil masterpiece and that did it. We can't bear to be too far from this pizza.
author: Laura H.

description: Ok updated review. Three more experiences with ZPizza and all good. The food is great, the website is easy to navigate and the delivery usually comes 15 minutes before due. I recommend this place for the discerning pie fans. We get inundated with commercials for the crappy food pizza chains and this is NOT one of them.
author: Steve E.

description:
Anyone who likes this, has never had REAL pizza. 

I just moved to SF and after a long day, I didn't want to go out; so, I decided to order a pizza. Based on yelp reviews, I tried here and had it delivered. I ordered a Berkeley Vegan and a Californian, both with a wheat crust. 

The delivery took quite a while: a bit over an hour for two personal pizzas and less than a mile away. The pizzas looked great, but the taste...not so much. Despite being loaded with a variety of toppings, they were both really bland and lacked any kind of punch. On the bright side, their boxes looked recyclable; on the down side, I think they make crust out of the same material.  Really disappointed. 

Is it the worst pizza I've ever had? No, but it wasn't great. What's worse is that it cost me nearly $30 - for two personal pizzas! I figured for that price, these were going to be fantastic. Sadly, I was wrong.

If you're looking to try to impress an out-of-towner with a pizza place with fancy ingredients, convincing them this is how SF'ers eat, then take them here. If you want a quality pie that tastes like pizza, you might want to try somewhere else.
author: Joshua C.

description:
My last review was almost a year ago and it's time to update that they're still awesome and wonderful and one of the highlights of my week. (We order every Friday or Saturday like the creatures of habit we are.)

After a lifetime of living it up with the gluten-filled vegan noms, I've learned I have celiac disease with an extreme sensitivity to gluten. I'm VERY limited in the places I can eat because of contamination issues and the limited GF vegan options. I've never once had a contamination incident from zpizza (after a year of ordering weekly!), and the customer service is top-notch. The gluten-free crust is definitely made with ingredients that include refined starches, and too much of a good thing is a little rough on anyone's belly, but I've never had a contamination issue and I've learned a valuable lesson in moderation of all gluten-free treats. (Yes, I HAVE attempted to eat an entire large in one sitting because OMG GF VEGAN PIZZA. I failed, and I still ate too much. But it's delicious. I just couldn't help trying.)

(Also regarding contamination: I'm not unreasonable. I expect it to happen once in awhile, if not from a restaurant then from their ingredient sources. I think going out to eat is always a gamble, which is why I rarely try new places. I'm amazed and thrilled at how conscientious the folks are here. I wish I could give you all some kind of award for your attention to detail and your interest in graciously and deliciously serving such a diverse customer base. Much respect. Thank you.)

It's definitely pricey pizza, but for something that doesn't cause me a health setback, and has a huge selection of fresh veggie ingredients, it's worth every penny. My days of disgusting $5-10 pies are over, anyway! (And I do remember how delicious Zpizza's whole wheat crust was! Well worth it whether you're a gluten-eater or a gluten-avoider.)

I love that there are THREE different kinds of mushrooms. The bell peppers are always fresh. They're not too heavy-handed with the Daiya cheese (I know it's delicious cheese, but it's easy to overdo-- Z does it just right), and those magic pizza ovens melt it perfectly. It'd be awesome if they added some black beans someday (or some other beany-type higher-protein topping), but it's no deal-breaker.

We almost always get takeout, and I make my own salads at home, but whenever I've had a salad here, it's always fresh and delicious. (And I love that I can add and subtract veggies easily, especially when I order online. Ordering on the website makes it so much easier to be the picky customers we are, and more clearly explain ourselves.)

Zpizza is one of my favorite parts of the whole bay area. I even got my parents hooked on it out in Arizona and they visit their local locations regularly.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Organic ingredients and great service. After I finished my meal my table was bussed by a very courteous staff member with his hat on backwards and a beard. You know, a kind of back of the house look like me might  not be very personal, but genuine and helpful. I thought it might be bus your own table but there he goes and polite and smiling. Felt like I wasn't in the city. Reliable and fast, seemed like lots of working folks from close by eat here.
author: Char D.

description: I popped in, the menu didn't grab me.  And I was frank & told the guy at the counter.  He recommended an Irish pub around the corner, buy the newspaper building.  Great time there, and it's manager appreciated Zpizza suggesting him.  And I appreciate Zpizza helping me out, even though I wasn't buying their product.  They are a + for San Francisco's visitor industry.
author: Mike R.

description: This place is legit! I paid like 8 bucks for  two slices of really tasty pizza and a refillable drink.  :)
author: Jed S.

description: So pleasant, great location, great pizza.  The slice selection is always great.  I love this place.  It is clean and the staff are always very nice.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Still LOVE their pizza and service! So delicious and fresh. Delivery is always fast and accurate. They are always friendly and great customer service
author: Piper W.

description: I like the fact that this place has a vegan cheese and gluten free bread. I'm not vegan, nor do I have an allergy, but it was just something I really wanted to try. It's definitely not my favorite pizza, or something I crave. But I appreciate that it caters to people who love pizza, but have difficulties ordering it, because they have allergies or are vegan. Again, not my type of pizza, but those extra options are a nice courtesy.
author: April D.

description:
If you're a health-conscious SF-er, like most of us are, you tend to want things as fresh, organic, local, etc. as you can get 'em. For the most part, there's plenty of places that offer that.

But if you're a health-conscious, *Vegan*, SF-er, those things are a little more hard to come by - especially when it involves not eating anything dairy. ZPizza is the solution for that, and an absolutely delicious one.

The great thing is no matter what pizza you get, you can substitute it with the Vegan cheese you normally buy at Rainbow (or something along the lines of that), so you can still get a pizza the way you're used to it, without any authentic cheese. And lemme tell ya, the Vegan cheese they go with is splendid.

Personal favorite: the Tuscan. Nothing else to say it's absolutely delicious. Tastes like a gourmet pizza, without a gourmet price.
author: Cristian G.

description:
I got all excited looking at the review and pics on the website and then I ordered the delivery pizza and pasta.... REGRET.

Pizza and pasta are nothing like the online pics.  Underwhelmed by the number of toppings, freshness of the pasta (looked like it had been warmed up).  There weren't too many options for pizza delivery to my hotel in Union Square, but I'd choose elsewhere next time.
author: Matt G.

description:
I was walking past the window when I saw that they have a special. I walked in and the cashier was polite and very down to earth. 
The service was excellent, the price was excellent and tasted primo!
Thank you for everything!

I would recommend z pizza to all of my followers, friends and everyone else who may be hungry or just a break from the fast food experience.
author: Chris E.

description: The pizza here was great! the parking isnt too bad. When arriving here the cashiers were very friendly and helpful. The pizza was made fast and on time. Ive been to the other locations of zpizza and i think this is the best one!
author: Brittany C.

description:
I decided to stop by this place after the MLKJr. Freedom Train parade was over. What a horrible mistake!

Although the food was delicious at the time, I went home and started having stomach issues. The ZBQ salad and pizza was the only thing I had to eat all day, so nothing else could have caused my upset stomach. The vomiting was another complaint and yet, another disappointment.

AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!! Until they can learn to wash the bacteria harboring in their salads.
author: Elidia C.

description:
Ok, ok SF foodies, don't kill me.  I'm giving zpizza a four star rating based on what it is in terms of San Francisco and how it is kind of tough to get that here.

Let's say one night you're doing some entertaining and decide you're going to have pizza.  It's raining and you don't feel like getting it and you have some prep to do so you don't really have the time either.  You want some decent pizza and you're trying to feed 8-10 people so nothing super fancy but also you don't want takeout from the grease shack on the corner or a Domino's poop pie.  

Zpizza is your solution.  

I ordered a Santa Fe and a Berkeley Vegan and both went over well.  It was enough pizza and much tastier than Dominos.  Most importantly, it got delivered in 40 minutes and on a rainy night.  Maybe it was a little pricey coming in at around $50 but in my opinion more than worth it to not have to lift a finger and have quality food at my gathering.

One tip; I'd definitely call in to confirm if your address is in their delivery radius.  This one is only about 10-12 blocks from me and their online system incorrectly indicated I was out of the coverage area.
author: Steven R.

description:
After reading the reviews I was really interested to try this place...wish I had spent my $30 somewhere else! Ordered 2 small pizzas - the Berkeley and the Californian. The crust was extremely soggy - kind if like eating wet bread. The overall taste of the pizzas was just bland. There was no real flavor and whilst it was filling, it was very unsatisfying. 
On a positive note, the vegan cheese was a lot better than I expected!
I'm all for healthy food but I can think of a number of better places to spend my money on to get it. I would not order from here again.
author: Elle B.

description: Definitely not a spot id come to sit and eat with pizza places like zero zero or even Capola close by. Take out pizza that is pretty mediocre and generally doesn't offer anything new or interesting topping or style wise.
author: Milan T.

description:
looks can be deceiving sometimes. i walked in here and thought to myself, oh another chain pizza joint.  i don't care, i was so hungry it would not matter.  cardboard on a plate with fake cheese and ketchup was the expectation.
what i got was tasty pizza from quality ingredients made with good technique.
i had a slice of cheese NYC style and it was served hot and crispy.
i need to find an excuse to get back here.
in SF, there are a lot of pizza places, but take note of the better ones like this spot, Gialina's, the Pizza Place on Noriega, Delfina Pizzeria and of course my personal favorite Arinell's. which looks like the polar opposite of this neat and clean pizza spot.

JYW likes!
author: Jeff W.

description:
It's hard for me to imagine giving 5 stars to a NY Pizza place that is some what health conscious.  Apparently you can order gluten free pizza here, get organic ingredients, etc.

Well I don't give two $#!ts about that.  I like dirty nasty new york pizza.  This place isn't dirty and nasty and the pizza was not greasy.  But, it was good, really good.  I really liked this pizza.  It's thin and the crust is a bit crip and really, it was just tastey.  It wasn't overloaded with cheese, just enough.

The customer service here was very good.  The staff here was very friendly and the place is clean.  Like I said, initially the "clean" look was a turn off as I thought it was going to be another froo-froo SF pizza joint, but nope, it's good pizza.

I'm glad I dropped in here randomly.  I'll be coming back whenever I'm in SF.  Oh, there's free WIFI here which is a big plus for me.
author: Vincent V.

description:
*pls note - this is review for carry out*

Tip: yelp check in gets 10% off entire purchase. You gotta check in to unlock

Got the Rustic chicken sausage pizza and a california salad.   Took about 15 minutes to get home, but the pizza was still warm.  The dough was pretty good, the good kind of chewy and not too salty.  The pizza is really thin... so a rustic really feeds one... trust me... unless u eat like a bird ...  beacuse the crust is so thin... the oil goes all the way thru... so dont expect any crunchy crust or anything....

i can do without the salad... it's pretty small... and not as fresh as think a salad should... but very average.
author: Kelly H.

description: I'm staying in a hotel that, according to Yelp, is one mile from zpizza. I placed my order using the restaurant's online system. It came to around $40. A few minutes later I get a call from the restaurant. "I don't know how our system let it through, but we don't deliver down there." Your system did let it through, though. How about honoring the order, instead of acting like it's a mysterious system glitch that can't be fixed by simple customer service?
author: David B T.

description: I was reading the menus to figure out if they have any vegan option while my husband asked the extremely rude and mean waiter who was at the cashier if he could use the bathroom. The rude cashier said you can't use the bathroom before you pay for your food. This is by far the most cheap thing I've heard in a restaurant. It's one thing to say we don't have public bathroom and another thing to say to a customer who is deciding on their food that they can't use the bathroom until they have their receipt in their hand. The restaurant smelled very bad and the floor and tables looked greasy too so the standard of hygiene is very low at this place. Again I have no problem with restaurant not allowing random people to use their bathroom but I do have problem with the way staff of a restaurant talk and communicate and I definitely care about politeness and expect people interacting with customers to be more pleasant and polite!!!
author: Parastoo M.

description: Good honest Pizza, fresh ingredients, short wait time  nothing to complain about here...
author: Nathan M.

description: Low key, but great food. The pizza dough is made an the premises and tasted excellent, the chicken cesar salad was great. Helpful and friendly staff. Well worth the money.
author: Toni I.

description: Overpriced, slow, and they screwed up our order.
author: Michael E.

description:
ZPizza has improved their customer service in the past few months.  I decided to take a risk and order from them again for a work event.  This time when I ordered pizza online they called me to check on the details and they delivered everything on time.

I'm also impressed that the manager replied to my last yelp review to apologize for the service and to assure me they were making changes.  Needless to say, they actually did.

The pizza is pretty decent and I like that everything is organic. It's also wonderful to be able to order vegan pizza with a gluten free crust for those in my office with dietary restrictions. My personal favorite: the mushroom & feta pizza.
author: Lara O.

description: Eh, pizza is very thin. Wasn't anything amazing, decent pizza overall. Driver was real slow and when I called because it had been over an hour I got a snappy guy who acted as if asking about my order was a real pain.
author: Justin W.

description:
I was skeptical. I had been let down by others before. Everyone SAYS it's good pizza but then you get this cakey, gummy mess. 

But then I (Im)patiently waited for a small gluten-free pepperoni pizza from zPizza. I didn't think I'd like it -- had their regular pizza before I was diagnosed with gluten-intolerance and I wasn't too impressed. (I'm an Il Borgo/Pizza Nostra fan true and true)

But this! I had been off pizza for months before and had just recently tried others. This  GF crust was...crewy! Crispy! Pizza-y! I sheepishly at the whole small pizza. (Don't judge)

Amazing. Would've been 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long! But ah well.

Already looking for a GF beer so I can have my beer-and-pizza night back.
author: joann p.

description: Crispy new york style pizza.  pretty damn good.  Eat it there right out of the oven.
author: Daniel W.

description:
zpizza is one of my new favorites in SF!  I first tried this pizza on a trip to LA and was blown away by the fresh ingredients and "healthy factor" of  the organic ingredients, wheat crusts, and even some gluten-free options.  You can imagine my excitement when they opened up an SF location.  So psyched!  

I visited their location on Mission Street, which is perfectly situated next to my unhealthy shopping habit of the Nordstroms/Westfield Mall.  We went with a group and we went "family style", ordering a few salads and different pizzas to sample.  

The salads are super fresh and delicious.  Typically, the salads at most pizza joints are generic & prepackaged, but you can tell that they're using much better produce here.  A great way to start it off....

Then the pizzas came out and we went nuts.  You can have a fantastic traditional pizza here, but I would recommend going non-traditional with their zpizza creations and rustica pizzas.  I think we sampled all of the rusticas, and a couple creations like ZBQ and Provence.  All were winners.

These pizzas are light and lacking the grease & oil that you normally get with pizzas here in SF.  No food comas after this meal - it got our night started out right!  Well done zpizza!

5 stars!
author: Jennica S.

description:
This pizza is really good. 
However, for a college student on a budget a fifteen dollar delivery minimum fee NOT  including tax and tip is pretty steep. A small cheese always comes out to around 21.50.
author: J. G.

description: Best gluten free pizza I've had in sf. I'm also lactose intolerant and allergic to eggs, (which pizza dough often contains) so finding pizza is nearly impossible. But here I can get a gluten free pizza with vegan cheese and I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. The dough is completely vegan too!no eggs! The crust is delicious, different from regular crust, obviously, but for a gluten intolerant pizza lover, I'm just happy to have the chance to eat pizza! Let alone good pizza! I asked, and they prepare the gluten free pizza dough in the back, away from all the other doughs, and they use separate knives and everything. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Love their gluten free pizza esp. the garlic chicken but I wish they deliver pass California St.  So minus 2 stars for the inconvenience.
author: Benjamin B.

description: We have gotten delivery from Zpizza quite a few times.  We usually place our order online and thy are awesome about calling us to let us know if the order will take longer than usual and confirm that we still want to receive it.  The pizza is pretty good, we usually order ours with extra sauce for more flavor and their meatball sandwiches are good too.
author: Erin D.

description:
gluten free pizza rock!  I seriously hope everyone will give it a try sometime ... you don't feel so FULL after indulging.
Z Pizza does it up right, and when in 'the city' (SF) they delivery to your hotel lickity-quick!
Thanks Z
author: Debbie S.

description: Stopped by to grab some pizza based on reviews. Took a short walk from the Marriott Marquis... Totally worth it. Great service, totally cheap... Two big pieces of thin crust sausage and mushroom and a soda for $7.  Very flavorful. If you're in the mood for pizza in DT San Francisco, go!
author: Sara R.

description:
Best gluten free pizza in the city.  Love the organic fresh ingredients!
Delivery almost always timely.
author: Sasha B.

description: So freaking good!  Get the pizza with mushrooms and truffle oil.  Ohmugod, wish I were eating that right now.  Sausage arugula one was also really good.  I ordered 4 pies and everyone said they were really good (didn't get a chance to try the others ones b/c my friends ate them so fast!).  I also love that they use organic products, and make their packaging etc out of sustainable/recyclable materials.  Owners/workers are super friendly and nice.  Will definitely be calling them again!
author: A L.

description: This pizza was great.  Glad I was able to get a gluten-free, vegan cheese pizza.  The pizza was really good, I really enjoyed the crust and the fresh ingredients.   This place was timely as well.  I ordered my pizza online.  Everything was correct.  When I walked in, I just told them my name and they handed me my pizza! Awesomeness
author: Tatiana T.

description: If you are at a convention, skip the overpriced madness of the convention center and walk a block for some tasty and reasonably priced pizza!
author: Lou L.

description:
My husband and I are now huge fans of zpizza!  We had two Rusticas (Curry Chicken and Yam, and Mediterranean).  I couldn't have imagined the combination of curry and pizza, but it was surprisingly good.  We also ordered a strawberry and goat cheese salad, which was excellent.

The thing about zpizza that's different from other pizza places we've tried is that it seems so much fresher and healthier.  The pizza is delicious and you don't walk out with a gut bomb or food coma.

Give zpizza a try!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
My husband and I finally ate at Z Pizza and it just blew my mind. I don't often get to experiment with new pizza because "R" is a dedicated "North Beach Pizza" consumer and he always gets his way when we go out on the limb of ordering pizza for dinner ("pizza" is definitely a special occasion meal for us).

At Z Pizza they use organic flour for the crust.  It's thin crust pizza. We had the mushroom, caramelized onion, and truffle oil pizza.  It's OUT of this world.  They have really nice salads, and the large is very shareable. We shared an arugula, walnut, blah, blah, blah salad that was huge and delish. They are featuring a strawberry, goat cheese & greens salad right now that is seasonal. 
The location/ space is very underwhelming so I never expected such quality ingredients from this humble hole in the wall.

We "ate in" and the only wine they offered was a split of Sutter Home.  OMG, it was like airplane wine. Better to take the pizza home and enjoy your own wine. There were plenty of bottled beers from which to choose. If you happen to be a real wine snob then you could prob BYO and no one would notice (you're subtle, right?).

The "pizzaiola" who prepared our dinner said that the mushroom pizza is her favorite. Maybe the others don't have the same level of flavor development? I'll prob never know b/c I'm stuck on the mushroom/ truffle deal. 

If I find out that they deliver to our neighborhood, it's sayonara North Beach Pizza, helloooooooooo Z Pizza.
author: passion f.

description: Good, but not worth the wait.  We ended up waiting close to an hour for our pizza because someone called in 20+ pizzas for catering and left the restaurant with no ability to service walk-in customers.  Vegan Berkeley pizza was yummy, my daughter said the regular cheese (which is not what she wanted, but they couldn't seem to make her other slices in an hour) were nothing special.
author: Pete D.

description: tried them after getting flier in the mail and pizza arrived cold.. called and complained and manager sounded really concerned and promised investigation and comped next order. Last night I called and he told me delivery bag on previous had been defective and discarded and replacement arrived hot and tasty.  Was extremely impressed with how they handle complaint and this will be my go to pizza delivery in the future...
author: ira l.

description: Went here for lunch during oracle open world and the pizza was great as well as the price. They had a two slice special with pop under $8 pretty good for downtown San Fran
author: Raymond H.

description: Great place to grab a quick slice of pizza to go or come and hangout with friends. Casual atmosphere, great pizza. Can't go wrong.
author: Justin H.

description: I love z-pizza and I was looking forward to enjoying them tonight; however, this location does not deliver to hotels.  No explanation given (I prepaid via Yelp's ordering service).  I get it, bad mojo/city law/something...an explanation would have been kind.
author: Sara L.

description: Very tasty pizza and breadsticks. My only concern is that I felt the size to be less than what I expected for the given measurements (e.g. they told me 10" and I don't think so).
author: Derek S.

description:
So far the three times I've been here the different slices have been quite amazing. Tonight I tried the California salad with caramelized onions & chicken breast.
I am semi hooked and it's on the way to the spa. I want to try other items now. I also love that they are open later for a salad on the way home.
Delicious!
author: Willie A.

description: Went here the other day, service was great and friendly. Pizza was good. Salad was also good. Guy didn't know if the Caesar had anchovies in it and when he found it out it did from the chef, offered to give me another salad right away. That was cool. I only spent a couple of bucks but was nice to see that kind of service and care.
author: Traci H.

description: Best tasting gluten free pizza I've ever tried. Tastes even better than regular pizza. Not too greasy or heavy either. Tastes like they use organic products. Their delivery is always quick, and even with poor parking or heavy traffic, they always bring it right up to the door.
author: M M.

description: As always, great pizza  Try the whole wheat crust, its healthy and tastes great too.
author: Craig N.

description:
Working around the corner on Fourth and Market, we only just fond this place for lunch.  Five of us went out to celebrate a coworker's last day and we ordered a range of food (mostly pizza, but one person picked a sandwich).  

Tables come stocked with parmesan, chili peppers and a housemade chili oil (dried chili peppers in olive oil).  Orders are placed at the cash and then you wait at your table for the waitress to bring it out to you.  There's the option for pickup and take out as well.

There's two main types of pizza: a normal pie shaped, and the rustica, which is more like a flatbread with toppings but still very pizza-like.  The rusticas are good if you don't want a large meal.  

The menu lists some amazing toppings such as vegan cheese and fake meat products for the vegetarians.  There's also some really amazing looking pizzas offered, easily reviewed on the online menu, but there's also some employee designed pizzas listed on a whiteboard when you go in.  

As a huge fan of pizza, this is definitely a place I'm going to return to. I tried the Mediterranean Rustica pizza, but am looking forward to trying some of the veggie meat ones.
author: Cassandra J.

description: I was having the ham & pineapple pizza, it was fine but not outstanding. It's a good place to grab a quick lunch or dinner if you don't want to go out too fancy.
author: Tom K.

description: Gluten Free amazingness!  Seeing the staff wash their hands between dealing with/ serving pizza's was really comforting.  Awesome pizza too, visited twice in my fortnight in San Fran and both times excellent pizza made by fun, polite staff.  Will be returning for sure!
author: Nick S.

description:
So first of all, the pizza was pretty good. Not the greatest, but not bad by any means. There were four of us, and we split the large Mexican Pizza (Salsa, Mozzarella, Spicy Lime Chicken, Green Onions, Red Onions, Fresh Avocado, Sour Cream, Cilantro).  

Having said that....can't say I enjoyed much else.  Wasn't a fan of the service.  Took 30 plus minutes for the pizza.  And it wasn't very crowded.  There was one person that worked at the counter, in particular, that was incredibly irritating and rude.  Probably in my Top 10 of most annoying people of all time that work at a restaurant.  Also, the atmosphere was bland.  Yes, it's a pizza shop, but the prices are a little higher, so my outlook is the atmosphere should be up to par.  I'll let you make your own judgement though.  

If you couldn't tell...this Yelp entry was dedicated to "complaining."   I probably won't make it back to zpizza.
author: John R.

description: Went here for lunch - nice clean space. Ordered the Pepproni small pizza, took about 10 mins to get served. The pizza was fine - pepperoni was of good quality, nice marinara sauce. But I am a thin crust fan, and they don't do the crispy thin crusts I like, hence the 3.
author: Manasi G.

description:
Ok, so when I called here for delivery, maybe I shouldn't have agreed to an estimated wait of almost an hour and a half. But I was craving pizza bad and this place sounded awesome. As the hour and a half finally approaches I'm pretty much STARVING. that's when I get a call saying they need an additional ten minutes. Ok, fine. But then they were late on top of that -- ouch! 

The pizza arrived finally, and it was warm. Not hot, but barely warm. Warm enough to eat. Heck, I'll eat almost ANYTHING at that point. 

I was disappointed that they forgot a topping. The pizza I ordered was tomato and basil. They somehow managed to forget the fresh basil topping. That's like 50% of the toppings! 

Despite it all, I totally devoted the pizza and it was pretty good. Then again, after waiting two hours, maybe anything's going to taste amazing!
author: Ryan L.

description:
A brand new pizza spot with lots of good, organic ingredients between the choices of crust (certified organic, gluten-free, or wheat), cheese (part-skim rBGH free or vegan mozarella), organic sauce, and MSG-free meat toppings.  $10 seems to be the going rate for a personal pizza (10" size) at this San Francisco location.  Pepsi on tap for refilling (I'm more of a Coca-Cola guy, but I'll let it slide....). Brick oven for a crispy, relatively thin crust pizza that tastes very good!

Ed U. and I shared an American pizza and a Casablanca ... both worthwhile and tasty!

Be sure to visit their company website and join the ztribe for coupons and such via email. I signed up, and received a $5 off a $20 order coupon immediately.

I believe they're open until 10pm on most evenings, but they just opened so this might vary.
author: Jamie W.

description: Toppings were very fresh and tasty! Best pizza I've had in a long time. Perfect crust and they deliver in a very timely manner. Highly recommend this place.
author: Shivs B.

description: Yum!  Pizza is delicious.  We usually get pepperoni with mushrooms, and I love they have different kinds of mushrooms from which to choose.  Crust is not too thick and sauce to cheese ratio is very good.  Delivery is usually quite fast and definitely within estimated wait times.  My only comment for improvement is their menu for sides and salads -  what's wrong with just a simple side salad?  They're just too fancy for pairing with pizza.  But definitely has become a go to place when we want a pizza delivered!
author: Michelle C.

description:
This place delivers! We got delivery in and it was delicious.

What I Got:
The half-and-half - Basically it was half of the bacon bleu pizza and half of the garlic chicken. These were really good,especially since I'm not a fan of marinara sauce (which is problematic at most pizza places). This place had a lot of options that were non-marinara which was great. Of the two halves we got, both were good but I like the bacon bleu one better - 4 stars.

I am not a pizza person really so I think 4 stars means it was pretty tasty!

Handy Tip:
If you're getting delivery - make sure you leave a note for how much crushed pepper or parmesan cheese you want on the side. We didn't specify and they brought us 3 packets of crushed pepper and no parmesan (but I don't usually put parmesan on my pizza so this was fine). I would've liked some more crushed pepper, but it was my fault for not remembering to note it during the order.
author: Melissa L.

description: New Haven Pizza will and always be my number one pizza in my heart. After a whole day of being sick and unable to stomach much all day and watching some old video clips of the Ninja Turtles eating a hot cheesy pie of pizza to get their mutant power; I felt like pizza would help restore me the way it did for the Ninja Turtles. This is when Yelp came to the rescue. I was too sick to leave the house but not too sick to eat Domino's pizza so I did some research. Zpizza popped up as one who has both good reviews AND deliver. There was even a handy app to order either take out or delivery. I with the Half Thai and Half American pie and it arrived promptly at my door within just less than 45 mins. The pizza itself was tasty. The thin crust was thin but I myself preferred it being more crispy. Nevertheless, the whole package is good overall. The toppings were fresh and the pizza itself was not overly greasy. Chunky pieces of chicken was very tasty with the Thai Chicken Pizza--kind of a better version of CPK's Thai BBQ chicken pizza. Will call you again when I'm sick and in need of some help restoring my Mutant Ninja Turtle power for sure!
author: Taffany H.

description:
I love pizza and wanted to check this place out.  On a cold night, the place was kind of bare and empty so I was a little skeptically.  I decided to try the Thai pizza that I'd heard about...and IT WAS UNIQUE & TASTY!  It came piping hot out of the oven -- with a thin flavorful crust, peanut sauce, chicken and bean sprouts.  This is a good California-styled pizza which includes healthy and organic ingredients.

Before leaving, I stopped by to grab a delivery menu and chatted briefly with the manager.  He mentioned that their most popular pizza is the Tuscany  mushroom which they sell by the slice on Mondays and Fridays.  He kindly offered me a sample to try.  It was DELICIOUS with three types of mushrooms and caramelized onions.   The rustic Moroccan pizza was also really good.

This New Yorker digs the California-styled pizza here!

Tip: The pizzas taste better at the restaurant while it's piping hot.  Takeouts not so much.
author: Lis A.

description: If your looking for pizza around the Mascone center this place is great for a quick sit down pizza.  I had the all meat pizza and wasn't disappointed.
author: Dan D.

description: Awesome pizza!! I had the Berkley vegan and my husband had a vegetarian one. The pizza sauce is some of the best I've had and they made it fresh. The pizza dough was perfect! Would be nice if they had more drink options besides fountain drinks but otherwise, very happy with this place.   The service was friendly and attentive. The guy told us a pizza could be made in 10min (since they didn't have any veg friendly slices available) and he was right!
author: Sophie S.

description: Vegan pizza was insane! Had the Berkeley vegan...so good I had to know what vegan cheese they use but service was lousy...girl looked pissed off to have to make my pizza
author: Prima D.

description: I must have walked by this place dozens of times and never noticed it and would probably never given it a thought if I did but thanks to my fellow Yelpers, it hit my radar. Its avg 4 star rating meets expectations. Great thin crust and fair price. Loved the musical memorabilia too. Extra points for the good service.
author: Tripp S.

description: Pizza is decent, but where the Tapatío and Valentina hot sauce? Us Mexicans need that hot sauce for our pizza XD
author: Oskar D.

description: After a long day of sightseeing, we didn't feel like leaving the hotel for dinner, so zpizza was our choice for delivery. We ordered the Cassablanca pizza, Mediterranean plate and flatbread sticks. Delivery was exactly what they quoted, and while it was a bit pricy, the quality and taste was great.
author: Amanda M.

description: This is the best real pizza that I have found in the city. they use real ingredients, real crust (not pricked with holes), and it leaves you wanting more.
author: Mark F.

description:
This is what ordering a pizza for delivery should be like. The web site ordering system is awesome! You can specify exactly what you want on each half, and even add/remove particular ingredients from their pre-built pizzas. The service was prompt (45 minutes), and the pizza was good. Not amazing, but very solid.

We had the zBBQ pizza, as well as a half-California/half-Sante Fe. 

I'm only knocking off a star because the 15% off Yelp coupon (the reason we tried it) didn't work, but they did redeem it when I called and asked.
author: Evan G.

description: It was good, but not the best. The pizza dough was rather tasty, but the sauce wasn't that great. Maybe next time I will not build my own pizza and I will go with one they have created.
author: Meggan W.

description: Amazing!  Went for the convenience, good ratings, and reasonable pricing and wasn't disappointed. :) I ordered a cheese pizza with pineapple to-go, and they kept it warm for me since I was late to pick it up.  LOVED that it wasn't greasy - at all!  I'll definitely be back here next time I have a pizza craving.
author: Jake H.

description: Hands down one of the best pizzas I had thin perfectly cooked nice cheese and sauce and it isn't very expensive you could get a drink and a slice for 4 bucks
author: Jhon G.

description:
First time customer.  Ordered a gluten-free California pizza for delivery. I ordered extra tomato sauce.  I ordered and paid for extra mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.  

Pros:  The gluten-free crust is the best I have had from any pizza place.  It tastes like crispy potato bread, a little sweet. The veggies tasted fresh. Delivery was less than 30 minutes.  

Cons:  I did not get extra tomato sauce as ordered, in fact I could not see the sauce at all on the pizza.  I could not see the extra mushrooms I ordered. I could not see the Parmesan cheese I ordered.  I don't believe they paid any attention to putting the extra items on my pizza, although they charged me for them.  

Overall:  If I am really craving pizza, I would give them another try only at the location and only because the gluten-free crust was very good.  No more delivery. I do not trust they will get the order correct.  Expensive and not high quality.
author: Irma A.

description:
Yes this is a chain but give it a try.
Regular or whole wheat crust I find it to be a good combo of chewy and crunchy.
My favorites are Tuscan and Provence, I have also tried their blue cheese salad, and believe it or not the sliced pears were fresh and crunchy, and the greens were fresh!

The pricing is not bad either..
author: M. M. K.

description:
2 slices of pizza and a fountain drink for $7.54 is a bargain that's nearly impossible to beat around here.  These guys just earned a spot in my go-to lunch pads.

Be sure to brush up on the lingo though - if you just point at the pizza you want they might pick the wrong slice.
author: Chris A.

description:
I work right by Zpizza, they are about a month old and I was skeptical when they first moved in because the prices seem pretty high. But I finally tried it and I'm glad I did, the higher quality of ingredients and attention to making genuinely good pizza and giving customers a nice experience is worth the price.

I went with a friend and got one of the specials, 2 Rustica pizzas, a healthy thin-crust piece of deliciousness made with creative and quality ingredients, each well-suited for one hungry person, and 2 fountain drinks for $17 (well, 18 something with tax). Although the service hadn't been super-attentive, when I refused the fountain soda cup the cashier offered me a bag of chips or two freshly-made cookies instead. I don't do soda or chips but those cookies got me and I could tell they do have the best intentions when it comes to the customer having a good experience. My pizza was tasty enough that I will be back soon, and not so unhealthy that I felt guilty after- the perfect combination!

The atmosphere isn't something to get excited about, but the people are chill- not always easy to find in SOMA. The pizzamaker even brought out a slice of what he was making for my friend and I to try.

To the person that thought they don't have napkins out- I did too, and when I asked the cashier for some, he politely came out right next to where I was sitting and pulled some out of a dispenser! For some reason the dispensers are kind of hard to notice, but they're there :).

For those with cars, street parking can be tough here but they're right next to a garage.
author: Ashley L.

description:
I was walking toward Wondercon and encountered Zpizza. I needed a quick bite before walking among the hoards of comic nerds so pizza it was.

The interior is clean and spacious. They have two tables worth of booth seating and chaired seating enough for about 25 more. Colorful walls and hung photography give the space a cheery, although cafeteria, feel. There were only two other customers there during lunch hour. I thought it was a bit odd how empty it was.

Single slices are about $3.50 each. I had a slice of Napoli pizza; garlic sauce, rounds of tomato, mozzarella, basil, and parmesan. The pizza was brought out to my table. Nice. I enjoyed the pizza. The garlic sauce is really good. All the ingredients taste really fresh and bright. In terms of crust, it's a thin crust but don't be expecting super super thin. I found the crust to be a little odd because the bottom layer of the crust has a very crispy bottom. So when you chew through the crust it kinda feels like you're biting through a cracker. I can't make out if I entirely enjoy it.

The pizza slices aren't huge nor are they small. To make it meal you'll most likely need two to three slices. The crust wasn't entirely my thing and it's a little small for the price. I wouldn't mind paying a little more to get a bigger slice rather than getting two slices.

Several things about this placed irked me. I needed to wash my hands before chowing down on some pizza so I asked where the restroom is. The guy told me where the bathroom is and gave me a serving spoon with a key on it. I understand why places do this but I really hate it. First of all, this spoon is going to the bathroom. Right after I wash my hands, I have to carry the spoon back to the cashier. So not only am I touching the spoon, but the cashier who is handling the food is touching it. Yuck.

Additionally, when I was given the pizza I wasn't given anything else. No water, condiments, or napkins. I was a bit annoyed about the napkins the most. I mean, it's pizza right? There aren't any napkins or condiments or self serve water anywhere. I don't mind the place has a self serve area for this stuff but there are none. Why not napkin holders at each table?

_____

I learned from the cashier that Zpizza is only a month old. Their ingredients seem fresh and their space is very clean and relaxed. There are many many better pizza places in SF but if you want a quick slice with a seated area this isn't so bad; however, if you can manage your hunger pains for another pizza shop do so.
author: Michael H.

description:
We use this place to cater for office lunches sometimes. 

They are reliable, for example: unlike some of the other places we have used you can order ahead of time and they actually know it's an advance order. 

They're nice & easy to work with. Online ordering is easy and they have lots of options. And the folks in my office like their pizza. Win.
author: Lady A.

description: Very pleased with this place.  Had the Napoli with a gluten-free crust.  It was delicious.  Fresh ingredients, good prices, and plenty of healthy options to choose from.  The guy who helped us knows how to give a recommendation, too.  Great service.  8-10 minutes for a hot pie, so worth it.
author: Sam B.

description: Quiet. Nice staff. Happy to deal with my indecisiveness and as always a decent Gluten Free pizza
author: Pilar M.

description:
Stopped in for lunch, and they have the perfect lunch combo: slice of pizza, side salad and a drink for 6.95. For the price, it was excellent.

The pepperoni slice I got was good, but the crust is what really hit the spot. Good flavor and a great crunch to it, even though it was a handtossed. The Caesar salad was nothing special, but went well with the pizza.

I would give them 5, but I would like more of there special pizzas available by the slice. Other than that, the place was perfect. Oh and the people watching outside was fun as its right next to the downtown San Fran college.
author: Michael B.

description: Looking for good pizza our last night in SF.  We stayed in Union Square and after shopping at Westfield we hit Zpizza shortly before kitchen closing.  Wife and I each got a salad and the large summer special.  Prosciutto and arrugala. The salads were huge and the pizza was outstanding!  Loved the decor and the casual atmosphere.  Exactly what I was looking for in a pie.  Healthy ingredients was the deal maker when searching for pizza online on Yelp.  This is hands down my favorite in the area.
author: Dan V.

description:
The pizza was pretty decent and their salad was fantastic! Everything was super fresh. The girl that helped me was more than friendly. I didn't expect that level of customer service from a pizza place. Totally a fan and I will be going back.

Also, I decided I really like what they're all about. Good food that's organic, animal and environmently friendly. :)
author: Tiffany F.

description: I was walking by looking for lunch and I seen the sign said gluten free, I kept walking because I thought it wouldn't taste good. As I was walking passed the second door I had to go back because it smelled so delicious. This pizza was great, I had the 2 slices and a drink. All under $10. I will definitely going back! Ps staff was great too!
author: Alexis E.

description: Great gluten free vegan cheese pizza :) Had to use all my self control not to order another right away! Would recommend to any :) Easy to find (for travellers) and the staff are really friendly which helps too :)
author: Ben S.

description: We're new to the city and after Yelping for some good pizza eats, zpizza caught our eye with a 4 star rating - Well Yelp, you did us no wrong because it was delicious. The staff were also really friendly and super helpful, so we'd definitely come back! I also left my phone on the tbale accidentally and one of the guys came running after me, so thanks mysterious zpizza staff, I owe you one!
author: S W.

description:
Update: I still haven't tried their pizza - but the owner did contact me about my poor experience. I was happy to hear that he viewed this as a coaching opportunity for the staff - and that this business does take customer service seriously.

I look forward to trying their pizza soon - and I'll post another update when I do.
author: Matt G.

description: Helpful staff who explained their gluten free options thoroughly even giving recommendations. Best gluten free pizza I have ever had! (had the zbq, didn't think bbq sauce would work on a pizza but wow!) Loved the records on the walls and the music that was on created a great ambiance!
author: Heather R.

description: Good pizza and great people. I got for the lunch special - 2 slices and a fountain drink for 7 bucks. Free Wifi. Perfect.
author: Jimmy B.

description:
I noticed this new pizza place in the neighborhood last week and was pleased to discover that there finally exists a sustainable, healthy option for pizza lovers in SOMA. 

Yesterday I tried their Tuscan pizza which was absolutely delicious. The bread was crunchy, but not too flat and it was not greasy at all. I loved the caramelized onions and the feta cheese was not too salty. This pizza definitely deserves 5 stars!

I actually liked it so much, I went back today to try their Berkeley Vegan pizza. That was a huge mistake! The fake cheese was simply bad. It was a gooey, unnatural looking and tasting weirdness that overwhelmed everything else. It tasted kind of sweet and I had a feeling that I am eating bubble gum with veggies. The fake meat on the pizza wasn't great either and the vegetables weren't anything special. I would prefer my vegan pizza without fake cheese and fake meat since there are plenty of delicious things to put on a vegan pizza.

I was so thrilled yesterday that I wanted to write a great review. Sadly, after the vegan pizza that won't happen. However, I will still go back for their Tuscan pizza for sure. I support sustainable businesses as much as I can, but I advice Zpizza to consider dramatically changing their vegan pizza option.
author: Gyöngyi G.

description: Not my favorite gluten free crust but definitely hits the spot.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Really good pizza, especially enjoyed the Thai Chicken
author: Connor S.

description: This pizza was exactly what we were looking for after a long day of sightseeing.  It was also a very reasonable way to feed a family of five.
author: Kelley C.

description: Excellent pizza - very tasty ingredients - nice crust- fast delivery! Whoops Amici's ass!
author: Patrick M.

description: Ordered 17 pizzas for a work-related function from Ian. All arrived on time, hot, and exactly as ordered. Delicious! Will definitely go back and try some of their specialty pizzas next time.
author: Lola G.

description: Walking in at an off time this place looked kinda pedestrian and the pizzas by the slice looked unappetizing so I kept walking. The next day I was craving pizza and this restaurant came up on Yelp as having four stars and it was the same place! I had a personal cheese pizza and it was good. I would definitely good back if in the neighborhood again.
author: Lesley P.

description: If you're in the downtown area south of market, you might like this pizza. They stress that it is all organic. You can buy pizza by the slice, and it is fairly quick. I would avoid this place if there is a large convention going on at the Moscone Center. The line can really get backed up. The last time I was there, I saw local journalism celeb Phil Matier eating a couple slices. Overall, this is a good new addition to the lunch scene in SOMA.
author: William R.

description: zpizza looked like it would be a sucky pizza place with re-heated slices.     They do have re-heated slices but they taste OK,  but much better than that was the calzone!   Freshly made and tasty.     It isn't exactly best-of-bay or date-night material but I think the guys here do a pretty good job given the price range,  and they keep it clean too.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Been here twice - first time I had a Thai satay personal pizza then the next time I had the two slices and a drink deal. Delicious both times, love the taste of the crust!
author: Carina D.

description:
Took over 2 hours for delivery. They argued with me when I called to inquire. I had the timestamp on my phone but they insisted I callednless than an hour before. Pizza was average. Better cause I was starving after so long. Bad customer service no reason to order again.

First time reviewer just because of this experience
author: Wesley G.

description:
Their Berkeley vegan pizza is one of the weirdest most interesting delicious pizzas I've ever had. Some unknown gooey cheese, delicious ground "beef", a very generous amount of fresh veggies and all of it on a perfect thin crust.

The service is also friendly and quick.
author: Mack D.

description: A friend and I went 'cause of their gluten-free pizza crust option. We picked out our various toppings and each got a small pizza. The gluten-free pizza crust was really good! She got GF and I got regular, and the regular crust wasn't bad but I think I'm going to order the GF crust next time because I liked the taste and texture a little more. It's light & crispy. I will happily recommend this place to others.
author: Christy S.

description: This place serves yummy food! The salad was fresh and the balsamic dressing was great. The pizza crust was perfect and the sauce on the mushroom pizza was just how I like it - not too heavy and fresh tomato taste.  The lunch special prices ($6.95) and the great taste were enough for me to go back again a second time in a three day stay.
author: Julie M.

description:
ordered for delivery and my pizza came 15 minutes earlier than i was expecting. another nice surprise was the awesome delivery guy that held up the food and exclaimed "GREETINGS!!" when i opened the door. i dunno, little things like that tend to make my day. 

on to the food...
i ordered the california pizza on a wheat crust and i was really satisfied with it. the ingredients were fresh and the pizza wasn't the least bit greasy. i didn't even have to dab it with a napkin [yes, i AM one of those people]. the crust was just the right texture for me - it's thin but still has some substance to it and has a soft inside but crisp outside. i also got the Mediterranean platter which is basically hummus, roasted red peppers, black olives, feta cheese, and cucumbers that come with pieces of pizza crust/dough that have been baked with some seasoning and olive oil. the pizza/bread was a little too salty for my taste, but you can easily brush off any extra seasoning.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Z Pizza offers a gluten free crust option (and it's delicious), but as described on the menu, it's NOT a gluten free restaurant. It was one of the few times I've had a reaction to gluten from something that was 'gluten free, but prepared near gluten', so I'm guessing they're not as careful as they could be. 

The 'gluten free' crust comes only in small (2 meals for me -- it's a 10'). The base price for a small pizza is $7.95, but there are extra charges for gluten free crust and dairy-free cheese. My pizza (with 4 toppings, gluten free crust, and dairy-free cheese) came to approx $20. Waaaay too much for what it was. 

I really enjoyed the crust. It was crisp and thin, but that the pizza itself was too oily for me. It was as if they'd sprayed it with oil before cooking it. It was drippy-oily. Maybe that was the vegan cheese -- I'm really not sure. 

Good luck!
author: Karen A.

description:
Today, I paid my first visit to zpizza. I came in around 12:35pm. I ordered a small American pizza to go. I didn't realize it at the time but they were in the middle of filling a number of huge delivery orders. I saw large pizzas after large pizzas get stuffed into a number of large delivery bags while I waited. Around 1:00pm, I inquired as to when I could expect to get the small American pizza I ordered. They told me 10 minutes. After about 10 minutes, the person who took my order came up to me and told me that my pizza got stuck to the oven and broke. They had to make another one and I would have to wait a number of minutes more. They were kind enough to offer a free slice of pizza while I waited but all they had was Tuscan and Cheese. I was not fond of either so I declined their offer but did ask for water and was provided a free bottle of Aquafina.

Finally my pizza came around 1:20pm and I brought it home. I have to say that the pizza was very good but the experience I had waiting for it was not. I am not the type of person who will stop going to a place based on a single bad visit. I will give them another try. I won't go on a Friday during lunch time though. If not for the long wait and the first pizza they made sticking to the oven and breaking, I would have given them 4 stars.
author: Rich M.

description: I have been coming here at least once a week for months and have just finally remembered to write a review. Ok, first, the deal I get there can NOT be beat ANYWHERE in downtown S.F. for what you get. You get a slice, a salad and drink for $7 plus tax. WTF? Where else do you get a deal like that? I always get their Caesar which is on par with the best I've had. Seriously? Crispy baguette-slice croutons, shaved Parmesan with a most wonderful creamy dressing and super fresh Romaine. I can load up the croutons with a bit of the dressing-coated cheese pieces and eat them before the salad. The pizza is very high quality, never a complaint. I wish I could catch more days when they have one of their chicken pizzas done for slices. They are the bomb. But my favorite pizza here is the Mexican. It's just one of the best combos I've ever seen. From the menu: "Homemade salsa, mozzarella, spicy lime chicken, green onions, red onions, fresh avocado, sour cream, cilantro" Does it get any better? The  workers are all awesome! And have music and memorabilia from the s.f. 60's & 70's scene. I haven't had any of the corporate work for them, but it looks by the reviews they are the Montgomery Scott (Ya havta be a mirrrricle worker!) of pizza. I've seen them cranking out tons of pizzas at 11AM when they open (I eat lunch early) and it looks like they never miss! They never have missed for me.
author: Jeff S.

description: I've been to zpizza for slices a few times.  Each time, I forgot what the pizza tasted like while still eating it.
author: Suo L.

description: Pretty tasty gluten free pizza.  Crust was crispy, and the toppings were just right.  I ate the whole thing in record time.  Yum.
author: Darcy J.

description:
As part of my never-ending quest for organic/local/sustainable lunch spots, I decided to search Yelp for "organic."  To my surprise, this pizza place "zpizza" appeared in the search results.  When lunch time arose that day, I eagerly started walking toward my destination.  When I arrived, I ordered what looked to be a slice of the classic Margherita.  Upon returning to work and taking a seat at my desk, I flipped open the box and dove in.  I immediately noticed the quality ingredients.  Everything tasted incredibly fresh.  The tomatoes and sauce had a superb flavor, likely due to the use of organic vine-ripened tomatoes which is a completely different food than the conventional artificially ripened tomatoes found in most supermarkets.  As I was enjoying my slice of pizza, I was shocked to read on the edge of the paper insert the following:

"Part-Skim, rBGH-Free Cheese From Grass-Fed Cows"

That's impressive.  Also, both the original crust and whole wheat crust are organic (I asked), and the tomatoes and tomato sauce are organic.  Every pizza I tried so far was delicious (though the "Provence" was my least favorite as the capers seemed to overpower it).

Overall, you can't get much better than this, especially as a semi-chain, so I give this place 4.5/5 stars.  I'd like to see an option for whole milk mozzarella ("low fat" doesn't necessarily equal healthier, and plus you lose the rich flavor) and more information about where their meat comes from.  Yes the meat is additive and MSG-free, but this doesn't necessarily mean it's high quality or healthy.  It's also possible the pepperoni contains sodium nitrate/nitrite as this isn't specified.  I appreciate the transparency that is given however, and the use of high quality ingredients, so this place is definitely on my visit frequently list.
author: Nader Z.

description:
I really was leaning to 4-stars, I mean I am a fan, but I just wasn't sure if it was THAT good. I enjoy the unique pizza choices they offer and I might come back to see if maybe I just didn't make an amazing choice this time. 

I went with the mexican pizza on wheat crust that has spicy lime chicken, avocado, sour cream onions and peppers.  I like the idea of this combo on a pizza, something different. But I thought it was just OK. The chicken was good, cooked well, and juicy, just not so spicy. Everything else was just a bit bland. None of the flavors really popped. it was just average joe to me.  I did like the wheat crust. I got a side salad and chose the vinaigrette dressing, the dressing was way too overpowering I didn't really eat it much of it. 

This place is good, just not WOW. I will come back to try the Thai pizza though! It sounds too interesting to pass up.

Oh the music here was great though, a lot of 60's rock. Jimi Hendrix, Beatles and such. This did make my experience rather enjoyable :)
author: AA B.

description: Excellent pizza - fresh and with a tasty crust.  I recommended it to the concierge at the hotel I was staying.
author: Phil W.

description: The pizza here is good, if not great.  My favorite pizza from my childhood is garlic chicken, and while they make it pretty well, it doesn't compare to some of its peers.  They do deliver though, which is a plus for lazy weekends.
author: Josh Q.

description: Delicious pizza, awesomely friendly and fast service. I am gluten-free, and pizza places are extremely few and far between (i've only found 3 others in the entire Bay Area, though i haven't done an exhaustive search). This pizza easily tops all other gluten-free pizzas i've ever had. The crust is thin, crispy, and tasty. I got the Thai for dinner and paid less than i did at the last best-gluten-free-pizza place (a place in Berkeley whose name escapes me). While i've had better Thai pizzas in my gluten-y days, this is very good. Fresh bean sprouts on top and just enough peanut sauce are high points.
author: Juli C.

description: Not your typical pizza. Much healthier, but still delicious. It's the type of pizza that's good all the way through, meaning you won't see any crusts left on the plate. Great salads and sandwiches too. This is the ideal place to grab a quick bite before (or after) a movie or shopping. Or if you work in the area, go for lunch. I had the lunch special (pizza slice, salad, and drink) for under $7. All in all, a great meal at a great price.
author: Curt B.

description:
I have ordered delivery #gluten-free pizza from here a couple times.  They are okay, not great.  Not sure what I was expecting, a crunchy pizza oozing with molten hot cheese?  Well friends, it wasn't that.  The crust was thin so as not to be doughy and have a raw taste to it, but it wasn't crispy.  I had to crisp up the crust myself.  The pepperoni is low-fat, which is great for being health conscious, but since when is pizza suppose to be an acceptable low-fat meal?  I think I would have been happier with the full fat pepp, a bit more cheese on the pizza and some SALT.  I thought the pizza was a little flavorless until I added some salt myself, and no I do not have high blood pressure:)
I ate my ittty bitty GF pizza and watched the fam enjoy a cheesy original version.  I was happy to be able to enjoy my pizza along with everyone else, but it didn't quite satisfy the craving.  I'll order from there again, but I'm still on the hunt for a GREAT gluten-free pizza.
author: Heather S.

description: Great pizza!  Really good service!  Had a pizza delivered to our hotel, and also had pizza by the slice from the restaurant; both were excellent, loved the variety of by-the-slice offerings.  Loved the decor, too!  Thanks zpizza!
author: Sarah K.

description: If your BAL is .08 or higher, or  you just smoked a big fatty or you are high on crack or for some reason AM PM is closed and you can't find rewarmed hotdogs, chimichangas, yesterdays pre-packaged sandwiches, or nuke-able food, then this is the place for you. Our pizza arrived at our hotel lobby on time, 30 bucks not including tip, not the kids fault. The pizza had no crispness, it folded like a wilted piece of lettuce, grease dripping down the sides. The next day though, the pizza was hard as a rock, a crack rock. In other words, this place sucks.
author: Tony N.

description: I love Z Pizza!  And this one has taken top honor for me.  In 3 days, I tried 6 of the pizzas offered (ZBQ, napoli, the Mexican, the Italian, pepperoni, and the Tuscan). Each one tasted super fresh, super yummy and fantastic!  I highly recommend this Z pizza.
author: Julie A.

description: Had dinner there last weekend after my daughter found them on the net. The place is clean and bright, staff is friendly and the food.......really amazing.  My teens loved the Napoli and ZBQ, I loved the Pear and Gorgonzola Salad and we also ordered the Penne w/Chicken pesto because we wanted to try a pasta too.  The food is organic & the portions are large.  It's reasonable, healthy and we would highly recommend this place. Great location too with parking which is a plus in SF.
author: Sandyra D.

description: This place is a little hidden gem. The pizza is great, as well as the service and the price is unbeatable. It's a nice atmosphere too, always plenty of seating and no wait. I'm a pretty picky customer and this place has been consistently great the dozen or so times I've been here. Recommend!
author: Niki H.

description:
I'm downgrading to 4 stars because of their lack of reliability. Boo. 

Some other notes: 
- Strawberry & goat cheese salad = awesome, 5 stars, I love it
- The parmesan breadsticks are also good, but the portion size really requires more marinara sauce and that option isn't available when you order online
- I had the pizza that has chicken sausage on it - didn't think it was anything special.

The strawberry salad is my go-to & gives them 5 star potential, but the fact that half the time I go to order it they either aren't delivering or are out of strawberries, makes me sad.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Ordered a pizza to pick up. guy says it will be ready in 15 minutes. I get there in about 20. There's no parking in front, so I just run in real quick to grab and go. Long story short, took more like 40-45 minutes to pick up, not 15. And they got the order wrong even though we repeated it about 3 times on the phone.  And the place was DEAD -- only 1 other customer, a handful of pick-up orders.  Incompetent workers who seem miserable to be there.  Plus their gluten-free pizza was just okay, not great.  All bad.
author: Latef X.

description: Cheap and good pizza a short walk from Moscone.
author: Michael D.

description: Finally! A really good pizza place that we can walk to and they deliver!
author: Peter S.

description:
as per the other reviews, if you are not clear which slice you want you won't get the one you point to, thing...its true! i pointed to the slice i wanted and got one from the other side of the pie. i didn't want to be all picky and lame so i let it go but i did think that was strange. i guess they don't speak regular-pizza-place-international-symbol for "i want that one". i'll know better next time.

i had one slice and it was very thin and did not fill me up.
BUT, it was yummy and organic--yeay!
so, next time i'll be more clear on what slice i want AND take two.

note to the staff: please adjust your attitude to match your product. i had a choice between twitchy greasy haired hipster and a chick with a wicked cranky attitude :/
author: Bad Ass Chic K.

description:
