healthy pizza?  count me in, dude!  i just noticed this spot last night when i was walking to the metreon.  i went in and realized it was "healthy pizza" -- low-fat cheese, fairly low-calorie. 

i had a slice of Napoli and was pleased with it. it didn't have the usual pizza greasiness (no oil-blotting-with-napkin necessary!)  it was super garlicky with a good crust; topped with yummy cheese that didn't taste low-fat. 

looking forward to coming here again and trying another variety.
author: Elle B.

description: Not bad for a chain. I used a Groupon for my first visit. I liked the different varieties of pizzas, as well as slices available for a quick lunch.
author: Lucia A.

description: Pretty affordable, I'll give it that.  The cashiers were friendly, but the pizza was nothing to write home about.  I'm familiar with the chain from back when I lived in Orange County and I remember it being better there.  Most likely I'll return because I work nearby but I'll try something else.  Maybe that gluten free stuff.
author: Katie H.

description: The pizzas here aren't traditional but the flavors are bold and flavorful.
author: Roger H.

description: Great pizza here, fresh ingredients and not overly greasy like some pizzas. I really liked the Tuscan.  Only draw back is they close early and don't deliver late night.
author: Christy Z.

description: Yum! Fresh ingredients. Crisp crust. Stick with the pizzas though. Salad is definitely not one of their strong points.
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description: Zpizza has a gluten free pizza that is quite good. the pear and Gorgonzola salad is tasty, but the balsamic vinaigrette is a bit heavy. A light raspberry vinaigrette would enhance the other flavors nicely.
author: Brian F.

description: if you are vegan and want your quick pizza fix, they have the solution for you but other than that, there are million other pizza options around.. not bad . I go here for their vegan pizza and they make it w/ vegan daiya cheese (which is my favorite vegan alternative to real cheese).
author: C A.

description: This is the best gluten free pizza I've had. Man, it's the best pizza I've had! Everything is fresh and you have a bunch of options. The menu is simple and you can make your own pizza with just about anything. Being new to gluten free, I didn't know that I couldn't have meatballs. They informed me, and brought me a list of gluten free options. They were so nice about it and the person who originally took my order came over to apologize. She was so sweet!
author: Alyssa H.

description: We had the large salad with caramelized onions and chicken.  Wow, very yummy!
author: Mike W.

description:
I had a semi healthy dinner delivered from ZPizza...it was great!  The whole process from when they took my order to when the delivered it was handled so well.  

I ordered the Moroccan rustica and the pear and gorgonzola salad.  The rustica was excellent.  Just the right amount with good toppings.  The salad could have used more pears but I'm just being picky!  Definitely a place I'd order from again.
author: Rosh C.

description:
Great gluten free pizza! So many creative and delicious options (they will even make their rustica pizza on gluten free dough), plus they make the extra effort and keep the gluten free dough separate from all the flour flying around the kitchen, so I feel very safe eating here. The gluten free pizza does take a bit of extra time (we waited about 25 minutes during weekday lunch hour) so just be sure to plan ahead. 

Total fan and plan to be back often!
author: Andrea V.

description: I had such an awesome experience last week using zpizza for a company event.  The owner was very helpful, customer service was top-notch and delivery was on the dot (one less thing to worry about when organizing an event).  I'm just glad I changed my decision at the last minute to use zpizza.  Highly recommended!  Thank you, Andy!
author: T M.

description: I was very impressed that they use cheese from grass-fed cows. So far, all their pizzas were pretty amazing. The veggies on the California tasted so fresh and the organic tomato sauce is great. I love that they give the option of a whole wheat crust.
author: Rita Z.

description: I went there because it was right around the corner from a convention I was attending. I'm not usually the easiest client but I have to say my experience was quite pleasant. The service was very polite and fast. I got my small pizza in less than 10 minutes and the pear salad- right away! There were a lot of people but the staff moved fast with a smile. I liked that. The Mexican pizza was very different from what I have tried before and was a delightful surprise! Everything tasted fresh and delicious. I'm all for the organic food too so A+ there. As a whole, good service, delicious food. I'll definitely come again if I'm nearby!
author: Vivian T.

description: I'm happy to report that the owner promptly contacted me after posting my review and very courteously apologized about the Yelp deal mix-up. He also kindly offered a free slice in compensation, which -- considering how good the pizza was -- I may take him up on. But seriously... thank you for the great customer service!
author: G. J.

description: Wonderful pizza especially the Mexican pizza.  I can't wait to get back to San Fran and eat there again.
author: Julian K.

description: Amazing pizza and "above and beyond" service.  It's nice to see a management team/owner that takes responsibility and backs up their product with excellent service.  Thank you zpizza.  This is a must try place if you like pizza.
author: Joe S.

description: Crust was really tough and chewy and worse, it tasted like they accidentally dropped a lb of salt into the dough.  Yuck!  Toppings tasted fresh and of good quality but still could not get past the salty tough crust.
author: Kevin M.

description: Very fast service (even to an area hotel).  I ordered a couple of the Rustica's to get a little choice -- The Chicken Sausage and The Mediterranean.  Nice well cooked crust.  Good flavor.  Definitely would recommend if you're looking for something easy and delivered.
author: Bob A.

description: I ordered the Vegan Berkeley pizza and was utterly disappointed.  I guess  I'm losing my patience with Daiya cheese because even thought it's vegan it never really sits well with me.  I can take it in small doses but this pizza was absolutely dripping with it.  There weren't many toppings on the pizza and those that were there were very bland.  Overall, the pizza has zero taste other than daiya cheese and the crust was soggy & undercooked.  It could have been a lot better if they cooked it longer, used 75% less daiya cheese and upgraded the quality of the toppings.
author: Rob C.

description: Ordered delivery via GrubHub, and it arrived faster than expected.  The veggie sub can be made vegan without cheese, and it's seriously delicious!  The vegan pizza wasn't the best I've ever had, though I haven't found any vegan pizza in San Francisco that compares to the vegan pizza in Minneapolis.
author: Tony G.

description: This is the best pizza I have ever had! I love the 70s posters on the wall and the music. If I don't eat all of it, I love having it for breakfast. The BEST pizza in San Francisco!!!!!
author: Leslie K.

description: The day after posting this review I got both a phone call and email from the manager of zpizza apologizing and offering to pick up the cost on my next offer.  I intend to take them up on the offer and appreciate them   taking the time to reach out and make amends!
author: Karma P.

description: I am vegan and I can't get enough of the Berkley Vegan! Great tasting pizza and you wob't find a better pizza around. I have eaten at the restuarant as well as deliveries and Zpizza never dissapoints. The owner is a very cool guy and you can tell he cares about his business. If you haven't tried this yet, you will be pleased with in every aspect. A+ all around, keep up the good work!
author: Joshua s.

description: ZPizza: YUMMY! Great options for vegans and veggies as well as the beast eaters in the group. Great salads with lots of choices. Gluten Free! and TASTE! Yeah! My new favorite pizza place!!! Friendly staff who know what they are doing- handle the walk in get a slice crowd as well as the quick sit down before theatre or between trips to off load shopping loot to the car.  The prices are great and the ingredients top quality, local for the most part and organic all.  They were out of the 'good' beer (New Castle Brown Ale) by the time I got there, but they had unsweetened Iced Tea! Yeah! This is a great place for a fast bite. I wished I lived in their delivery area!
author: KJ P.

description: My two favorite Pizza's are the ZBQ and the Curry Chicken and Yam Rustica.  The Crust is crispy, not oily, and it's all organic. Awesome !  If you're a salad lover try the ZBQ Salad .  My favorite place in SF for Pizza !
author: Dinno K.

description: zpizza is so legit! two slices with a soda for under 8 bucks? you gotta be kidding me!! super fresh and super clean...cant beat it in soma! i guess its gluten free too, bonus!!!!
author: J S.

description: Zpizza is one of the great places to eat downtown because of the healthy and delicious options it offers. I can get a gluten free personal pizza with vegan cheese, which doesn't taste bad at all. The ingredients and always fresh and the service is polite and attentive. There are some very interesting pizza combinations, which it took me a minute to try but it was totally worth it!! Example: the Pear and Gorgonzola rustica pizza- really light and very tasty! Prices are cheaper than Escape from NY or Extreme and yet they are organic! Go figure!
author: Victoria S.

description: I'm not a huge pizza fan because pizza is often heavy and sits like a log after you eat.  zPizza is light, crispy and uses quality ingredients (which I found out are also organic).  They also have a good arugula salad.
author: Roderick A.

description: delivery took an hour and a half after a 45 min quote online. i live about 4 blocks away. pizza was warm to luke warm. pretty good pizza though. felt bad for delivery guy cuz i gave no tip. decent food. awful service.
author: Roy R.

description: Stopped here during MacWorld at the Moscone Center.  The people were very nice, very helpful and very fast. The Gluten free pizza was thin  crust, and did not crumble.  Strong showing for a gluten free pizza.  Not the best I've ever had, but far, far, far from the worst. I recommend the gluten free pizza to all Celiacs or those wanting to avoid gluten.
author: Jason D.

description:
i was really craving pizza one day, and too lazy to make myself dinner, so i ordered from here seeing the good reviews on yelp, and the yumms looking topping combinations.

disappointed. my pizza arrived lukewarm, too few toppings for one of their special combinations. considering all that, it was way too expensive. i don't want to pay $25 for a medium pizza like that.

**note**the owner contacted me the day after i wrote this to ask me to give the joint a second chance, next order will be comped. i don't know if i will take him up on it because i'm not entirely sure how i feel about receiving free food based on my opinion of the place--but it's much appreciated, and i think it's great that he cares enough to contact some rando.
author: grace l.
